Title: Office Manager, Receptionist, and Bookeeper
Location: Hilton Head Island, SC 29926 (Palmetto Hall area)
job description:
We are looking to hire an individual to support three functions for our multi-business office: (1) Office Management, (2) Reception, and (3) Bookkeeping. The businesses include an industrial inspection company, an economic consulting company focused on the energy sector, a women’s clothing store (Birdie James on HHI), and an executive office suite on HHI (the location of our offices).
Office Management (10% of time): monitoring and ordering office supplies as needed, coordinating maintenance and cleaning services, monitoring and coordinating lease payments, , and some administrative assistance (word processing, light Excel data entry/manipulation, etc.).
Reception (25% of time): We own and operate a shared office space so we need support with fielding telephone calls, receiving and directing visitors, and show available offices for rent and provide information on virtual office packages.
Bookkeeping (65% of time): Work with our controller’s office to ensure accurate financial records for 4 unique operating companies by submitting hourly payroll data, managing accounts payable and accounts receivable (including invoicing), expense tracking and review, and account reconciliation with bank statements. All companies use QuickBooks Online.
Given the nature of this work is multi-dimensional and no day will be the same; we are looking for someone with broad experience AND/OR an eagerness to learn. We value clear communication, easy-going and collaborative attitude, yet an ability to work independently.
The successful candidate will need to be well-versed in Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, and QuickBooks Online. A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail is essential and experience with accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger accounting.
Required hours in the office will be 8-4 or 9-5 M-F & we are able to work in some flexibility with other support staff.

Title: Grants Manager
job description:
INDIANA SUPREME COURT, OFFICE OF JUDICIAL ADMINISTRATION
JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title: Grants Manager
Department: Fiscal Office
Salary: $50,000-$55,000 or more depending upon qualifications and experience
Status: Regular, full-time (37.5 hours per week minimum)
Responsible To: Controller
To Apply: Submit cover letter & resume by November 24, 2020.
Position Summary
This position serves as a Grant Manager with the Indiana Supreme Court’s Fiscal Division, applying generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), Government Accounting Standards Board (GASB), and 2 CFR part 200 (Federal regulations related to Grants) to analytical work during the thorough review of financial records related to assigned grants, ensuring compliance with Federal, State and funding source specific regulations, requirements, and related guidelines.
Essential Duties/Responsibilities
Makes recommendations to upper-level management on interpretations of grant regulations and application procedures and on section or unit objectives. Research new grants available and new and existing regulations for use in assisting and reviewing grant application recipients. Reviews existing grants and examines the fulfillment of federal and agency requirements and grant objectives. Assists in processing month-end financial statement closing through reconciling grant funds, reviewing journal entries and general ledgers for accuracy and quality control, then analyzing and reporting on variances. Manages account payable functions for grant funded expenditures including invoice/payment processing, requisitions, purchase orders, and reimbursements. Facilitates procurement of goods and services, including valuation of assets and approved vendors.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Serve as a primary point of contact for staff managing grant funded program, regarding utilization of grant funding.
Create projects in accounting system for grant funds, and prepare reports for Federal Grant fund drawdowns using the Federal Draw Billings module.
Configure workflow as needed for automated approval/coding, for grant projects.
Assist with financial reporting aspects related to the administration of all federal grants.
Ensure fiscal compliance for reimbursements, purchases, and utilization of grant funds; oversees funding sources, financial reports, and coordinates fiscal monitoring.
Prepare monthly reconciliation of accounts for compliance of charges in accordance with grant guidelines; decides proper handling of financial transactions and approves transactions within designated limits and assist with project account forecasting.
Discuss updates/changes with Project Manager(s) and Grant Coordinators; input, track and maintain budgets including reconciling: expense/revenue/drawdown amounts.
Receive, research and resolve a variety of routing internal and external inquiries concerning account status, including communicating resolution to stakeholders; respond promptly and in a positive manner.
Develop and maintain good working relationships with representatives from State Board of Accounts, Government Management Information System (GMIS), State Budget Agency, and related state agencies.
Escalate potential financial risks to appropriate management.
Maintain accounting controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures.
Configure workflow as needed for automated approval/coding, for grant projects.
Ensure transactions are processed consistent with established policies and procedures.
Assist in drafting policies and practices to instruct staff in best practices and requirements.
Support Fiscal division in other financial related activities, such as generating reports.
Ensure strong internal and external communications on status, issues, and expectations.
Strives to seek continuing education for Grant related topics and Federal Grants, where applicable.
Additional duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Accredited Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Finance, or related, and five (5) years of professional experience with grant/contract accounting and compliance.
Broad knowledge of grants, the grant application process and rules and regulations pertaining to grants applicable to assigned programs.
Ability to interpret and apply grant rules, regulations and procedures.
Ability to research new procedures, rules and regulations.
Experience in public sector accounting, a plus.
Experience in grant/contract budget development preparation, editing, billing, vouchering, and accounting contract compliance setting, required.
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook, intermediate to advanced.
Experience with financial software; general ledger, accounts receivable, accounts payable, grant ledger, billing and collections.
Working knowledge, or ability and willingness to learn PeopleSoft Financials and SharePoint.
Must have demonstrated ability to apply concepts and principles of accounting (i.e., GAAP, GASB, & 2CFR200).
Working knowledge of Accounting/Accounts Payable processing.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including grammar, proofreading, editing, and public speaking.
Demonstrate analytical and problem solving skills and ability to develop innovative solutions to a variety of problems of low-to-moderate scope and complexity
Excellent customer service skills and orientation; ability to deal professionally, respectfully, and tactfully with others
Ability to be flexible and work on multiple projects simultaneously, with varying deadlines
Ability to perform under pressure and comply with established deadlines
Demonstrated ability to follow through on tasks, pay attention to details, and work independently
High degree of data-entry proficiency without errors
Ability to identify information, materials, and resources needed to complete a project or assignment
Willingness to be a team player and function within a professional team environment
Must exercise absolute confidentiality; avoid conflicts of interest and the appearance of conflict of interest, abide by the Employee Handbook and Judicial Code of Conduct. Must be willing to submit to a criminal background check.
NOTE: This document is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed. It is not intended to provide an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities, nor is it intended to limit the authority of supervisors or managers to assign or direct the activities of employees.
The Indiana Supreme Court is committed to a work environment that values employees and promotes their well-being.

_ The Indiana Supreme Court is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal employment opportunities are provided to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, political affiliation, socioeconomic status, status as a protected veteran or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws, and the Indiana Judicial Code. _
If you are a qualified individual with a disability and will need a reasonable accommodation to assist you in apply for the position or to perform the essential functions of the job, the Indiana Supreme Court will provide such reasonable accommodations.

Title: Private Equity / Venture Capital NetSuite Controller
job description:
Who we are
Fusion CPA is an award-winning outsourced accounting, tax planning strategy, and growth advisory firm for businesses located in Atlanta, Georgia, and all around the United States. We are a very technologically forward-thinking and growth-minded firm, which extends to our clients and staff. Our clients rely on us to help them stabilize, analyze, and grow their businesses. Because we do a great job of this, we’re growing and are looking to bring a Private Equity / Venture Capital NetSuite Controller into our fold!
Who you are
Our Private Equity / Venture Capital NetSuite Controller will work closely with firm leaders as well as staff and clients and will be responsible for integrating and managing our client's financial management platforms via NetSuite. As we continue to grow our business, a critical part of this is the continued development of an accurate and efficient back office.
Our ideal candidate would be:
An experienced financial controller or accountant with 5+ years of experience using the NetSuite platform
An accountant with experience in private equity / venture capital accounting
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Excited by technology
Highly motivated and driven
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Client-focused
A detail-oriented team player
A problem-solver by nature
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Requirements:
Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in Accounting
Accounting experience in private investments / private equity / venture capital
Five years’ outsourced controller experience using the NetSuite platform
Proficiency in Acumatica, Microsoft Dynamics, and SAP
Ability to automate financial transactions and processes
NetSuite Administrator Certification / NetSuite ERP Consultant Certification
What the role entails
To succeed in this role, you must be someone who enjoys doing all of the essential tasks:
Handle daily case activities
Prepare cash and journal entries
Manage portfolio data reporting and analysis
Participate in quarterly and annual audit functions
Assist with new client onboarding and through the process of product adoption
Advise and assist with data migration from legacy accounting solution to NetSuite
Manage the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data
Demonstrate features and functionality to clients
Assist clients with best practices in using NetSuite
Serve as a subject matter expert for client inquiries
Improve the NetSuite environment including but not limited to streamlining and managing multiple user setup, profiles, and roles, customization of objects, fields, and record types
Offer recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes, including NetSuite projects that will simplify and automate processes
Evaluate the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting database, as needed
Develop and monitor business performance metrics
The Fusion CPA Way
We have an unbeatable culture dedicated to developing leaders within our industry. Our vision is creating a financial foundation & culture of accountability wherein CPAs & clients thrive together! We intend to be the CPA firm of the future.
Individuals who exhibit the following characteristics tend to be a great cultural fit for Fusion CPA.
Attention to Detail
The diligence we show in our work makes the work of the next person clear and clean.
Customer Service
Understanding that our best clients are our current clients and the referrals they can give us help us grow.
Respect
We respect the value of everyone's time and priorities.
Passionate
We take immense pride in our work and constantly strive to meet and exceed Fusion's expectations.
Accountable
We hold ourselves independently accountable to the work we are entrusted with
People
Recognition of the need for both emotional stability and the desire for growth. Our people are our most valuable asset & we support them however we can.
We take care of our employees. We value our employees, and we will pave the path for your career progression. We consistently provide continuous learning and training via mentorship from both our internal and external experts.
How to apply
*
Submit your resume with the email subject [your first and last name – Name of Position Resume For Fusion CPA]
*

job description:
Financial Controller
The Early Learning Coalition of Northwest Florida is looking for a highly qualified individual to join our Fiscal Team in the role of a Financial Controller. This is a full-time position with benefits.
The major functions of the Financial Controller position include, at minimum, the following:
Manage all accounting operations including Billing, A/R, A/P, GL, Purchasing, Cost Accounting, Inventory Accounting and Revenue Recognition
Coordinate the preparation of the budget and financial forecasts and report variances
Prepare and publish timely monthly financial statements
Coordinate the preparation of regulatory reporting
Research technical accounting issues for compliance
Support month-end and year-end close process
Ensure quality control over financial transactions and financial reporting
Manage and comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings
Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls
Manage finance staff
Creates reports using Tableau
Additional controller duties as necessary
This may be a telework position, however employee is required to be available to attend in person meetings and appointments.
Salary range: $45,000-$55,000
Salary will be based on experience.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in accounting or similar field. Transcripts/diploma will be required.
5+ years of overall combined accounting and finance experience, non-profit experience preferred
3+ years managing accounting staff
Thorough knowledge of accounting principles and procedures
Experience with creating financial statements
Experience with general ledger functions and the month-end/year end close process
Excellent accounting software user and administration skills
Tableau experience a plus
Competencies
Ability to work with diverse populations
Exemplary telephone and customer service skills
Excellent organizational skills
Manage detail with precision
Time management: prompt and responsive
Advanced written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Manage competing demands and multiple deadlines.
Eager to learn
Handle confidential information with care
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Ability to learn and implement other technology
Available to work flexible hours
Travel locally: must have valid driver’s license and consistent transportation

Title: Public Senior Tax Manager
job description:
Senior Tax Manager
We are in search of an exceptional Public Senior Tax Manager for a highly respected mid-market Houston area accounting firm. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of Public Tax Management experience with a proven track record of success. The compensation package is aggressive and includes overtime compensation that can boost total annual compensation an additional 10%. The firm's benefits package is very strong and internal vertical advancement opportunities within the firm are highly preferred.
Core Competencies:
Demonstrates a high level of technical proficiency.
Demonstrates an understanding of business issues relating to complex transactions.
Works and communicates effectively with staff and clients to enhance their understanding of business and tax issues.
Demonstrates an awareness of Firm software packages and the ability to use such software effectively.
Motivates subordinates to take full advantage of computer technology.
Demonstrates effective oral communication skills through formal presentations, training sessions, speeches, etc.
Skilled at preparing complex client correspondence including recommendations, technical issues, proposals, etc.
Demonstrates an awareness of current business developments and the ability to determine the impact to a client's business.
Demonstrates an understanding of recent tax developments and their implications to a client's business.
Develops a high level of expertise in one or more specialized industry areas, but is still able to perform very effectively as a "generalist".
Demonstrates an ability to research complex tax issues and/or direct the research activities of other staff.
*
Client Service Expectations:
Demonstrates a thorough understanding of the client's business that extends beyond tax-related aspects.
Develops and maintains strong business relationships with individual clients and appropriate financial officers.
Identifies issues and recommends creative solutions to complex client issues.
Organizes work schedule in a manner that ensures timely and priority-sensitive services to clients.
Effectively identifies and delivers cross-selling opportunities to our clients.
Personnel Development:
Motivates staff through professional and technical reputation and enthusiasm.
Effectively and appropriately delegates assignments to foster an environment of mentoring and teamwork.
Coaches and develops the staff's understanding of our business and the business world in general.
Provides staff with honest, objective and constructive feedback in a timely manner.
Is accessible to staff as a sounding board for concerns and questions.
Proactively involved in the recruitment of new and experienced staff, through referrals and interviewing.
Instructs and facilitates both internal and external training.
Serves as a role model and coach for staff.
Balances personal and professional goals and encourages others to do so as well.
Participates in, and thoroughly documents, the formal review/evaluation process with staff in a timely and effective manner.
Functions as a manager, rather than as an employee.
*
Fiscal Responsibilities:
Recognizes problems, assesses alternatives, and recommends solutions.
Monitors and efficiently controls all time spent on a project.
Effectively participates in the billing and collection process.
Identifies and implements value-added billing opportunities.
Closely manages individual productivity (realization, chargeability, etc).
Seeks opportunities to provide additional services to clients, and pursues those opportunities.
Identifies cross-selling opportunities, and follows up leads with appropriate client personnel.
Actively participates in business development efforts.
Seeks opportunities to provide new and innovative products and services to clients, and demonstrates the ability to develop such products.
Effectively retains Firm clients.
Displays the attributes of an "Ambassador for the Firm".
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $150,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Public Tax Management: 8 years (Preferred)
License/Certification:
CPA (Preferred)

job description:

Planning, directing and reviewing all phases of non-profit audit engagements
Planning, directing and reviewing all phases of audit, review and compilation engagements for clients in other industries, which may include: construction, professional service firms, government contractors, employee benefit plans
Applying the technical skills to perform an effective review of 990 returns. This means performing the necessary level of review to ensure that relevant issues have been identified and resolved, planning opportunities explored, and that returns are complete and ready for Principal review
Developing relationships with engagement related personnel who are responsible for accounting matters
Providing research and consulting services, including coordination with client’s other advisors

Capacity to demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills
Understanding of how to apply principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Ability to demonstrate strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to train, orient and mentor staff

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
Position Summary
The Accounting Manager is responsible for all areas relating to business and financial reporting. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining accounting principles, practices, and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial statements. The Accounting Manager will manage business licensing and tax filing (sales, use, income, etc.) for all relevant jurisdictions. They will coordinate business insurance for risk management as well as oversee 401(k) plan administration.
Key Responsibilities
Manages direct reports within the Accounting Department. Assigns and allocates work, sets priorities and deadlines. Resolves personnel issues, guides, and advises personnel in the performance of their work. Completes performance evaluations and makes recommendations on wages and promotions.
Responsible for business registration and licensing in all required jurisdictions.
Prepares Federal and State tax filings and ensures compliance for all relevant tax jurisdictions.
Responsible for monitoring disbursements in accounts payable and payroll. Signs and reviews weekly check runs, ACH payments and wire transfers.
Monitors AR Collections and past due account activity. Assists AR clerk in escalated issues.
Responsible for reviewing the fixed asset and inventory systems and accounting for acquisitions, disposals, and depreciation/loss unit expense. Prepares reports on inventory balances, write offs and significant adjustments.
Responsible for monitoring the correct posting of cash to the accounting system and the proper deposits of monies into bank accounts. Review and approves general ledger reconciliations and analysis of variances.
Responsible for monitoring compliance with expense reporting practices and debt covenants.
Coordinates audits and satisfies auditor requirements.
Lead Annual Budget and Monthly forecasting planning processes, as well as achievement of Budget and Quarterly Forecast goals.
Establishes and communicates the process including required outputs and timelines.
Provides financial expertise during the business/budget planning process.
Ensures individual functional plans/assumptions are communicated/coordinated between departments/functional areas.
Partner with Sales and HR on the design and development of RSM Sales compensation systems. Deliver accurate, timely commission calculations for payment processing by Payroll/Accountant.
Manages the development of policies and processes for financial operations control and reporting in the area of budgeting, financial planning, forecasting, cost control and capital investments, etc.
Prepares and or approves journal entries. Monitors and approves account reconciliations. Reviews trial balance at month end.
Analyzes balance sheet and income statements and actual versus budget or forecast reports, includes detailed review of variances. Provides management with monthly and year to date Financials upon completion. Directs department close goals and timelines.
Coordinate annual renewal of business insurance policies.
Oversee 401(k) plan administration
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Experience / Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance with a minimum of seven years Accounting or Finance experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong PC skills including Excel, Access experience as well knowledge in medical field is a plus.
Must have the ability to lead and coach others as well as the ability to facilitate and negotiate.
Must have strong verbal, written and interpersonal skills. Strong presentation skills.
Must possess the ability to organize and prioritize work while meeting deadlines. Must be able to lead and manage projects effectively.
Ability to work with others from a wide variety of backgrounds and cultures and at all levels within the organization.
Physical Requirements
General office environment that will include frequent or continuous periods of talking, sitting, fingering, repetitive motions of the hands/wrists, reaching, grasping, and handling. This position also requires occasional bending, squatting, standing, and walking. Pushing, pulling lifting, and carrying of up to 10 lbs. is required on an occasional basis. Good general vision and hearing are needed.

Title: PRODUCTION CONTROLLER AIRCRAFT (TITLE 32)
Company: US Department of the Air Force
job description:
Duties
Summary
This is a National Guard position is for a PRODUCTION CONTROLLER AIRCRAFT (TITLE 32), Position Description Number D0752000 and is part of the SC 169 MOF/Air National Guard.

Responsibilities
This position is located in the Plans, Scheduling, Documentation/Engine Management Section of the Maintenance Control Branch. The purpose of the position is to perform preliminary (advance) planning and long term scheduling for the utilization and maintenance of all assigned aerospace vehicles, propulsion units/associated equipment and related support training equipment, and to perform duties related to the documentation function.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Coordinates and develops operational and maintenance requirements for all assigned aerospace vehicles and related support and training equipment into long range, quarterly, monthly and weekly plans to produce a schedule which makes efficient use of resources. Ensure the Maintenance Control Supervisor and the Chief of Maintenance are advised of maintenance capability, problem areas, and adherence to schedules. Schedules aerospace vehicle and related equipment, through all phases of maintenance. In coordination with Job Control, assigns work priorities to all scheduled maintenance to assure a balanced workload of all maintenance sections. Coordinates with upper level management and other functional areas on master parking plan, bulk munitions requirements, supply support, food service support, security, motor vehicle maintenance, petroleum oil and lubricant (POL) requirements, fire department service and civil engineering functions. Compiles and publishes required maintenance plans in a timely manner to project aircraft, equipment and personnel utilization.2. Schedules and conducts daily maintenance planning meeting to refine and incorporate unscheduled maintenance requirements into the Weekly to Daily Maintenance Plans and workload requirement. Reviews specialist dispatch and in-shop production workload to ascertain production delay, recommends corrective actions and makes necessary adjustments in production schedules. Processes requests for and manages local manufactured items to ensure that unauthorized work is not scheduled. Coordinates with Quality Assurance in scheduling activity, technical inspections and publication changes. Coordinates with Training Management to minimize impact of training schedule in accordance with pertinent ANG directives. Initiates and maintains maintenance operating instructions establishing procedures for the assignment and application of job control numbers.3. Preplans requirements to support operational launch schedules, emergency war orders (EWO) and contingency plans. Designates and schedules aerospace vehicle for maintenance training purposes. Plans and schedules time compliance technical order (TCTO) accomplishment. Schedules and insures that life support and critical items are replaced in accordance with the time change program. Performs the aerospace vehicle distribution function in accordance with directives. Analyzes maintenance capabilities in conjunction with Production Analysis. Coordinate and maintains input schedules to prime depots for accomplishment of depot level maintenance such as TCTO modifications and Programmed Depot Maintenance (PDM). Computes and evaluates scheduling effectiveness in order to improve management efficiency and decrease deviations. Reviews and verifies the accuracy and validity of aerospace vehicle weapons documents. Establishes procedures for the identification of repeat, recurring and cannot duplicate type discrepancies which impair mission performance or affect safety of flight, and for review of corrective action for adequacy.4. Represents the Chief of Maintenance in coordinating actions such as aircraft and equipment utilization, sortie rates, flying hours and simulator utilization with the Air Commander, Operations and other members of the flight scheduling committee.5. Develops inspection work package for aircraft; schedules and conducts the preinspection meeting for scheduled inspections such as periodic, isochronal and phase. In coordination with maintenance supervisors, develops work packages for major, intermediate level maintenance such as battle or crash damage.6. Performs the following documentation functions; review, filing, maintenance and disposition of historical documents for assigned equipment. Manages documents for TCTO reports, time change forecast, mechanized reports, master ID number files and flight status register. Submits request for parts or kits for TCTO and time change items to the maintenance supply liaison for processing to Base Supply.7. Makes required input to the automated data system and retrieves data and/or computer generated products as required.8. Conducts training of assigned technician and military personnel.9. Performs other duties as assigned.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
None
Job family (Series)
1152 Production Control
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
This is an excepted service position that requires membership in a compatible military assignment in the employing state's National Guard, required prior to the effective date of placement.
Selectee will be required to wear the military uniform.
Acceptance of an excepted service position constitutes concurrence with these requirements as a condition of employment.
Males born after 31 December 1959 must be registered for Selective Service.
Federal employment suitability as determined by a background investigation.
May be required to successfully complete a probationary period.
Participation in direct deposit is mandatory.
For positions requiring the operation of motor vehicles, candidates must have a valid state driver's license for the state in which they live or are principally employed.
Applicants must be in the military grade listed in this announcement.
Qualifications
THIS IS A NATIONAL GUARD TITLE 32 EXCEPTED SERVICE POSITION OPEN TO AREA OF CONSIDERATION (AOC): 1-2 ONLY. *PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO AOC 1*

AOC DEFINITIONS:
Area 1: Current permanent employees of the South Carolina Air National Guard. (Note-Temporary and Indefinite employees do not meet permanent tenure requirements and will not qualify for this AOC)
Area 2: Current members of the South Carolina Air National Guard.
Area 3: Any individual eligible for membership in the South Carolina Air National Guard.

Min Military Grade: SrA/E-4
Max Military Grade: MSgt/E-7

Compatible Military Assignments: 2AXXX, 2R1XX, 2WXXX.

GENERAL EXPERIENCE: Experience, education or training which indicates the candidate can reason in quantitative terms, communicate orally and in writing in a clear and concise manner, understanding the terminology and data pertaining to repair operations and process characteristics of the production activity.

SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Must have at least 24 months experience, education or training preparing job or work orders; scheduling various phases of projects into the production facility; following up to see if work is progressing as planned and arranging for adjustments in materials, machine processes, and work sequencing allowing for changes. Experience with current automation support programs to input data, provide status of equipment, and monitor job order status, monitor work priorities, requisition repair parts, track repair parts status, etc.



MILITARY REQUIREMENTS: Military skill set is determined by AFSC requirements. Upon selection, individuals must be assigned to a compatible military AFSC in accordance with statutes and National Guard Bureau regulations and must obtain/maintain all requirements of the AFSC.

If you are found to be among the top qualified candidates, you will be referred to the selecting official for employment consideration.

Title: CPA/CFO Client Success Manager
job description:
Do you want to join the fastest growing bookkeeping company in the US?
Profit Matters is hiring a client success manager. We are seeking an impact driven CPA to join our team, spear heading coaching and guiding small business owners to make better decisions with accurate financial statements.
We need someone who is passionate about helping entrepreneurs grow and scale their business by increasing their profit margins. We want someone who is a hardworking team player and fits the culture. This is a remote position that offers a very flexible schedule working from home.

Ability to work remote

Manage cash flow

Title: BILLING & MEMBER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE MANAGER
job description:
Position Summary
The Billing and Member Service Representative (MSR) Manager serves as a critical connection between our membership and the Cooperative. As a successful candidate, one must possess excellent interpersonal communication skills; being fluent and at ease in high-pressure situations involving member complaints and other issues. The main responsibilities of this position focus on coordinating critical interdepartmental functions, integrating meter and other critical data, billing and collections of member payments, understanding and reporting monthly statistical analysis, and, above all, providing best-in-class member service. Personal characteristics required for this position include, strong leadership skills, being able to direct the work of others balanced with working collaboratively with a variety of people and groups (inter/intra-departmental and external). The ideal B&MSR Manager is attentive to details, people-oriented, well-versed in billing and financial analytics, and has a keen sense of business acumen and leadership.

Work Hours/Conditions
This is a full-time, salaried position working a minimum of 40 hours per week
Typical work schedule is Monday through Friday, 8 am to 5 pm
Majority of work takes place in a controlled office environment with minimal noise level
Must be able to travel for annual conferences and training throughout the nation (<15% of work requires travel)

Education/Experience
Bachelor’s in accounting or a closely related field is required
5+ years of progressive management experience with a cooperative, utility, or allied industry in the areas of customer service, credit, and billing is required
5+ years in staff management is required
Prior knowledge and experience with data processing techniques with accounting and reporting is required
Advanced Excel skills and Intermediate presentation skills are required
Advanced ERP skills are required, preferably SEDC-UPN or NISC
Familiarity with billing laws and regulations is preferred

Certification/Requirements
Must possess a current driver license and maintain an insurable driving record.
Must be able to complete and pass CPR and First Aid training. On-job training provided.

NOTES:

Additional Salary Information: • Medical - $167 per month for entire family with a 100% employer-funded HSA, other options available. Eligible 1st of month after 30 day of service • Dental - $11 per month for entire family. Eligible 1st of month after 30 day of service • Pension - 100% employer-funded with a 2.0% benefit level / 62 plan; eligible after 1 year. • 401(k) - Match up to 4% on full salary; eligible after 1 year. • Basic Life - 4x annual salary, 100% employer-funded • Long-term Disability - 13 week/50%/No SS Offset, 100% employer-funded • Life Insurance - Additional $40k policy, 100% employer-funded • 10 Paid Holidays • Paid Vacation & Sick Leave • Annual Stipend for cell phone and clothing • Service awards every 5 years of service • On-site fitness facility - free for entire family • Company Parties • Facility usage (Banquet area, dumpster, ice machine) • Covered Parking

Title: Controller & Manager Order Processing
job description:
Who We Are
ReStockit, founded in 2004, is an online pure-play B2B seller of a broad assortment of Essential Business Products including Office Supplies, Office Furniture, Cleaning Products, Food Service/Breakroom Products and Industrial Supplies, targeted to the SMB (Small-Medium Business) Market. Working with numerous distributors, redistributors, and manufacturers, the company provides an assortment of over 100,000 products on Restockit.com. We’re focused on helping businesses operate more efficiently and effectively, so they can serve their customers better. Based in Plantation Florida, we're dedicated to providing an exceptional e-commerce shopping experience and having the right products our customers need, with fast delivery, and supported by a knowledgeable customer service and direct sales team.
Who We Are Looking For
Reporting to the President, the Controller will lead the budgeting and financial management of the company, as well as manage our B2B order processing and customer support team. You’ll be responsible for all the usual Controller functions, with the support of an Accounting Coordinator, while ensuring efficient processes and controls are utilized in order processing. The individual we seek is a hands-on leader who will perform well in an entrepreneurial environment and has a forward lean towards continuous improvement and doing it right. Most importantly, you will partner with the President in developing the metrics and reporting required to manage and grow the business effectively and profitably.
Key Duties and Responsibilities
Prepare/maintain/review monthly financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flows as well as ad-hoc financial analyses
Manage the month-end close process, including review of journal entries, account reconciliations and account analyses in a timely manner
Lead the preparation of the annual budget and latest estimates
Administer all accounting operations including Billing, Credit Card Processing, A/R, A/P, GL and Revenue Recognition
Manage credit limits and vendor payment terms, ensuring timing collections and appropriate credit risk
Manage payroll processing payroll utilizing ADP
Oversee the preparation and timely monthly filings of state sales tax returns across the U.S., using TaxJar
Enhance and implement financial and accounting systems, processes, tools and control systems
Oversee cash management and serve as a primary point of contact on commercial banking relationships
Direct the activities of the order processing and order support staff, ensuring that orders are processed accurately and efficiently, and ensure when order exceptions occur (returns, defective shipments, damaged shipments, short/incompletes, etc.), they are processed effectively to optimize the customer experience
Oversee cash management and serve as a primary point of contact on commercial banking relationships
Experience/Skills
BA/BS degree in Finance or Accounting required; CPA desirable
Minimum of 8 years of progressive accounting experience with at least 2 years as a Controller
Experience working in a B2B or B2C products company preferred
Operations experience highly desirable
Must be effective as a hands-on, player-coach, with the ability to identify problems and drive solutions
Exhibits a positive, can-do attitude
Advanced proficiency in Excel and Quick Books; experience with additional accounting software a plus
Excellent interpersonal skills; effective communicator
What We Will Offer You
Where you work with is as important as what you do. We have a collaborative work environment where we seek to balance the personal and lifestyle needs of our team members with the business imperatives of the company. Our staff is talented, committed, and nice too!
In addition, ReStockit has a flexible work location policy, combining 3 core, on-site business days each week, with the option to work from home the balance of the week.
We also offer medical, dental, short/long term disability, and vision coverage, 401(k), as well as a culture completely focused on delivering a great online shopping experience.
**This role will be remote while COVID restrictions are in place. The expectation is to be onsite at ReStockit's Plantation, FL office location once it is deemed safe to do so**

Title: SUPERVISOR OF GENERAL ACCOUNTING
job description:
Responsible for supervision of general accounting functions including accounts payable, general accounting, work orders, plant accounting, payroll, and accounting for the Cooperative’s military installation. Contributes to the financial integrity, accuracy, and timely recording, posting, and reporting of financial transactions. Facilitates active communication within Accounting Services and among other work units of the Cooperative. Serves as advisor to the Manager of Accounting Services in recommending improvements to procedures as well as modifications to accounting policies and practices as may be required to comply with prevailing FASB standards, RUS guidelines, changes in law, and related regulatory requirements.

EDUCATION / TRAINING:
REQUIRED:
B.S. degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Finance or Accounting
Minimum 3 years’ experience in RUS electric cooperative accounting
Minimum 2 year’s supervisory/managerial experience in managing the work of others and maintaining effective relationships
Experience in subsidiary/ancillary accounting (governmental contract auditing considered a plus)

Preferred:
Certified Public Accountant

KNOWLEDGE / INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Required:
Proficiency in the areas of expense analysis, accounts payable, payroll, property records and long-term debt acquisition
Accuracy in detailed analysis and computational tasks
Must possess human relations skills generally associated with a supervisory position in order to effectively supervise accounting personnel
Must be tactful with good interpersonal skills and ability to accommodate and capitalize on diverse personalities; and be capable of conveying a positive and professional image
Must be able to lead and coordinate multiple activities and projects simultaneously as well as work with and consistently meet deadlines
Must be able to work effectively with auditors
Must be able to write legibly as well as read and comprehend material; and display effective written and oral communication skills
Must be able to perform spreadsheet operations on computer utilizing Microsoft applications

Preferred:
Thorough knowledge of work order procedures, general, and subsidiary ledgers in order to have complete familiarity with the financing and operation of rural electric utility
Strong history of supervisory experience demonstrating ability to successfully mentor and motivate employees while building a positive and productive work environment
Experience using SEDC (Southeastern Data Cooperative) software
OTHER:
Must have and maintain a valid Georgia driver's license with a safe driving record
Must be willing to travel between offices and attend meetings out-of-town, work overtime during peak periods and on short notice, and expect to work under pressure at times to meet deadlines.

Title: Controller
job description:
Job Description
Job Summary
Adirondack Winery is currently seeking a Controller. The ideal candidate would be high energy, A-type personality that is driven to achieve in their career, and takes great pride in their work. If you have worked with a small and fast-growing, family-owned business in the past and had a hand in their growth, we would love to talk to you. We are looking for a candidate who is comfortable building upon our current financial procedures. While not required, an interest in wine is a plus!
Experience executing accounting and bookkeeping for multiple business lines and types is important, as Adirondack Winery has several layers including Manufacturing, Retail, Events, E-commerce, and Wholesale. We are also the organizer of the Adirondack Wine & Food Festival (Adirondack Festivals LLC) and the Controller is responsible for the accounting and bookkeeping of this company as well. The Job responsibilities of this position are varied and touch all facets of our business.
If you are interested in helping to guide and be directly involved in the growth and direction of the company, you work for this position would be ideal for you.
Responsibilities and Duties
The Controller will be responsible for all financial activities, including managing A/P, A/R, creation of various financial statements, costing, cash flow projections, budgeting, taxes (sales, use, and excise), financial planning, payroll, supervision of Office Manager and work with outside accounting firms, banking, and insurance.
The Controller is also responsible for the financial oversight of each of our tasting rooms including cash handling procedures, purchasing oversight, and budgeting.
This position is expected to learn and develop advanced knowledge in our proprietary cloud-based POS and eCommerce system, to produce and analyze financial and inventory data that is useful to the company.
Qualifications and Skills
This position is extremely hands-on and detail-oriented and bears much responsibility, so the applicant must be trustworthy, self-reliant, organized, and have a great ability to prioritize and multitask. As a small growing company, the ideal candidate would be able to offer opinions and work to find solutions to problems outside of their job description as needs arise.
Qualifications include a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience/education in the field of finance, accounting, business, or equivalent, and a minimum of 5+ years of accounting experience is required. A demonstrated knowledge of accounting principles, bookkeeping, payroll, and human resources oversight.
As a quick growing and expanding company, a successful candidate needs to be adaptable to the needs of the company and be willing to find solutions to problems and successfully implement solutions. You must be willing to do what it takes to help our company to grow and be the best in our industry.
Physical demands: Must be able to remain in a stationary position for 50% of the time, sitting or standing. Constantly operate a computer and other office types of machinery such as calculator, copier, and printer.
Working conditions: The ability to work in an office setting with multiple people and/or distractions, a retail location with many customers and employees. Must be able to maintain reliable transportation to get to and from work sites.
Disclaimer:
Nothing in this job description restricts management rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. This job description is subject to change at any time.
Benefits
This position reports directly to the Company CEO and will work closely with the company President and managers.
Adirondack Winery's head office is a casual, small family business setting. We welcome members to our team that are enthusiastic, dedicated, and trustworthy. We are a fast-growing company with an opportunity for future advancement for smart, hard-working employees.
This position reports working at our headquarters in Queensbury. The preferred work schedule is Monday through Friday, however, flexibility may be possible. Due to COVID restrictions, this position may require remote work.
This is a Full-Time, Year-Round, Salaried Exempt position that provides Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, PTO Time, and other benefits; including Wine Perks!
As we are looking for the right person for the long-term interest of our company (not just the right qualifications), we are considering candidates with a wide range of experience for this position. Salary commensurate with experience.
Please apply with your resume AND cover letter explaining why this specific position at our company seems like it would be a good fit for you. If your location is not within easy driving distance of Queensbury, NY; please also include commentary on your relocation or commute intentions. Applicants are encouraged to research our company before applying. Applicants who do not adhere to the application requirements will not be considered.

Title: Tax Manager / Senior Tax Manager
job description:
Why Should You Apply Here?
When you join us at Nigro & Nigro, PC, you will be part of a brilliant, driven, yet fun team that shares your passion for helping clients and delivering quality tax and business services. We are not your stereotypical accountants, but rather we are individuals who laugh and enjoy life while maintaining an unsurpassed level of professionalism that our clients have come to respect. Title: Sr Finance Manager /Controller
job description:
JOB SUMMARY: The Sr Finance Manager is a hands on management position they will oversee the day-to-day finance operations and financial strategic development of Crisis Connections. They will analyze and interpret financial data in relationship to actual operations in order to strategically and tactically develop and prepare financial plans, budgets and forecasts. Oversee budgeting and financial projects, dash boarding of critical metrics and work with the Crisis Connections leadership team to ensure reports are accurate and timely.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT
Provide recommendations to Snr Leadership team and Executive Director regarding best business practices, financial ratios/analysis and other changes based on financial evaluations and industry standards.
Oversee the annual budgeting process for directors and department heads through a strategic period of evaluation and future vision casting.
Review donor type mix ratios in collaboration with other Directors and ensure increased efficiency in operations.
Lead Crisis Connections’ strategic plan initiatives relating to Finance and Compliance.
Monitor integrity of donor intent and full-costing allocations, in collaboration and coordination with Resource Advancement and Crisis Connections’ Operations.
Fiscal Management
Oversees Payroll (Paylocity) and supports benefits administration in partnership with HR.
Manage the preparation and development of Crisis Connection annual operating budgets, forecasts, revised targets, and ongoing reports and analysis. Ensure timely and relevant production of documents, reports and budgets.
Compile financial analysis and dashboards for Crisis Connection. Design management reports and key performance measures as needed.
Provide financial analysis and related research of monthly Grant Reports, looking for trends and areas of concern, to enable accurate program and operations management.
Other duties as assigned
COMPLIANCE AND RISK MANAGEMENT
Oversee compliance with U.S. Government federal and other international bilateral and multilateral institutional grants, keeping current on regulatory requirements and monitoring compliance.
Manage and oversee grant and foundation proposal, reporting & compliance functions including review of sub-recipients to ensure compliance with terms of sub-agreements and applicable grantor rules and regulations.
Develop and manage systems and processes related to grants to ensure compliance and requirements for the government and NGOs.
Develop new systems and processes as needed, providing support to operations in implementation.
Investigate allegations of fraud or code of conduct violations in a manner that aligns with the organization’s mission and vision and recommend appropriate action.
Develop, update and recommend to senior leadership policies, processes and procedures and follow up as necessary to ensure implementation.
Advise senior leadership regarding changes, trends or developments that might influence decision-making or pose additional risk to the organization.
Review, establish, implement and administer and/or coordinate policies and procedures necessary for the effective Finance and Compliance functions across Crisis Connection
Provide managerial audits, conduct research and special projects as assigned.
Primary manager for budget development, monitoring and expense control of WCDO and Finance & Compliance department budgets.
Assure timely filing of legal documents and licenses.
LEADERSHIP
· External Relationships.
Represents organization to outside agencies, contractors and the general public with professionalism.
· Internal Relationships.
Models and collaborates with leadership and all staff in a positive and cooperative manner with leadership and managers in order to promote the mission of Crisis Connections and ensure its success.
· Managing Performance to Excellence Encourage excellence in areas of work performance, ethics and department morale among team members. Manages and coaches financial staff
SUPERVISOR RESPONSIBILITY
Supervise Crisis Connection Finance Staff with authority to hire, develop and maintain appropriate short-term and long-term objectives, strategies, standards, work flow, evaluate performance and recommend termination.
Take initiative to build capacity, to ensure finance staff are equipped to perform their roles and responsibilities with accuracy and professionalism.
SKILLS AND WORK/WORK HABITS
Written and verbal communication is clear, concise, accurate and thorough. Demonstrates genuine relationships by cooperating with others, handling disagreements directly with the person(s) concerned in a truthful and open manner, and accepting constructive feedback. Shows respect to co-workers, volunteers and customers/clients. Promotes a healthy work environment by demonstrating collaborative decision-making and team-building behaviors; provides peer support, and motivates staff and volunteers to outstanding performance. Suggests solutions to identified problems. Sense of humor.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Accounting from an accredited college or university recognized by the United States Department of Education or equivalent.
Certified Public Accountant and/or Certified Management Accountant, or equivalent experience.
Seven years or more of Accounting/Finance or Business Management experience. Nonprofit experience preferred.
Five years or more of experience with demonstrated success in budgeting, planning for future fiscal years
Three to five years or more of Grant management and governance, including experience with U.S. Government grant compliance.
Three years or more years of working as a business manager, accounting manager or in a Senior finance leadership role, in a Not-for-Profit setting, with the ability to lead and teach team to meet operational requirements to optimize business office functions.
Microsoft Office Suite, with a strong focus on Excel.
Working knowledge of accounting software packages.
DISCLAIMER:
The information presented indicates the general nature and level of work expected of employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain, or to be interpreted as, a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, qualifications and objectives required of employees assigned to this job. As an adaptive organization, responsibilities can and will change in alignment with greater efficiencies and mission metrics.
COMPENSATION:
Crisis connections offers a competitive salary and generous benefits which include but are not limited to paid time off, health/vision/dental insurance, and 403(b)/TDA retirement plan.
Pay range for this position is $85,000 - $95,000.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY AND NON-DISCRIMINATION:
Crisis Connections (CC) is committed to equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. CC does not discriminate with regards to hiring, assignment, promotion or other conditions of staff employment because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected under local, state or federal law.

Paid time off

Schedule:
Monday to Friday

All employees are required to wear a mask at all times. Maintain your social distance when while in the office.

Title: Business Manager/CPA
job description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
POSITION TITLE: Business Manager
POSITION PURPOSE: To manage the financial affairs of McKee Botanical
Garden, including all accounting duties. Responsible for financial management including accounting, purchasing, personnel, administration of payroll and benefits and financial record keeping.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate degree in Accounting, with a minimum of five years experience, preferable in not for profit accounting. Must have a strong knowledge of budgeting, financial planning and human resources. Must have strong attention to detail and have good people skills. Must be extremely organized and be able to handle tasks simultaneously.
REPORTS TO: Executive Director
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Financial Management:
1. Perform bookkeeping in the daily operation of the Garden, including: cash flow and cash management, posting and paying accounts payable, café rental and Vista billings, posting and collecting accounts receivable, recording and depositing cash receipts, maintaining necessary ledgers and preparing periodic financial statements, and preparing payroll and reports. Provide management with timely reviews of organization’s financial status and progress in its various programs and activities.
2. Prepares long range capital and operating budgets, reviews budget proposals, and prepares necessary supporting documentation and justification.
3. Work with Executive Director to produce reports which summarize and forecast organization business activity and financial position in areas of income, expenses, and earnings based on past, present and expected operations. Is responsible for the overall accounting function of McKee Botanical Garden.
4. Prepare monthly financial reports for Finance/Executive Committees and all department heads.
5. Supervise compilation of financial data to provide audit trails and supporting material in preparation for the annual audit.
6. Perform monthly reconciliation of all Garden accounts.
7. Stay abreast of all federal, state, and local tax laws as they affect the Garden to ensure compliance with the law.
8. Work with Executive Director to ensure that there is adequate insurance based on current valuations of plant, equipment, vehicles, and liability.
9. Prepares reports required by regulatory agencies.
Purchasing
1. Ensure that all purchase requests are within established budgets.
2. Work with Department heads to ensure that quality products are purchased, and prices should be negotiated whenever possible.
Contractual Services
1. Evaluate services for advantages and disadvantages of contracting out vs. in- house performance.
2. Ensure that appropriate insurance is maintained on all buildings and grounds.
3. Maintain copies of all annual contracts and work with Department heads on reviewing and renewing the contracts annually.
Employee Benefits
1. Administer retirement plan, group medical, workman’s compensation, and other benefits of the Garden.
Other
1. Perform all other duties as requested by Executive Director and Director of
Operations
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $21.00 - $25.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location:
One location
Hours per week:
20-29
Typical start time:
8AM
Typical end time:
4PM
Work Remotely:
No

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
Serimmune is a rapidly growing immune intelligence company that combines the excitement of cutting-edge technology with the desire to improve human health and wellness. We are looking for an experienced individual who thrives in a fun, fast-paced, changing start-up environment. We are currently seeking an Accounting Manager to join our team!
The Accounting Manager will play a critical role in helping to build the Finance department and to scale accounting functions for best practices and growth. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to make a difference and get involved in the early stages of new system designs. This individual will assist the VP of Finance and senior leadership in developing and automating systems, identifying and implementing best practices, driving financial accountability throughout the organization, and living our cultural values.
Tasks & Responsibilities
Manage month-end and year-end close processes
Manage period-end report generation including financials and departmental reports
Help perform detailed financial statement actuals vs budget analysis with variance reporting for both corporate and departmental levels. Utilize NetSuite’s budget tool, currently excel based.
Maintain fixed asset subledger/integrated with ERP, depreciation schedule, and assist with year-end physical verifications
Play key role in system implementations and become company expert with NetSuite and NetSuite Budget and Planning.
Assist and prepare schedules for audits, tax returns preparation, and other annual requirements
Manage and process accounts payable and cash requirements oversight
Manage contract liabilities (deferred revenue) and assist with revenue invoicing, receivables, and revenue analysis
Prepare accurate and timely journal entries and reconciliations of balance sheet accounts
Manage and process payroll accruals and partner closely with People & Culture on payroll matters
Help document and improve accounting processes and policies for internal controls
Work closely with other departments and assist with new internal controls that impact accounting such as inventory, purchasing, people & culture, and sales
Participate in various special accounting projects, reporting, and ad hoc assignments as needed
Solve practical problems and deal with a variety of business tasks
Other duties may be assigned
Education and Experience
A Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S.) in Accounting, Business Administration, or Finance; may consider a combination of other education, certificate in related area and/or relevant work experience
Minimum 5 years of previous accounting experience in a similar or more senior role
Previous experience working in start-up/change environments and with financial audits (preferred)
Experience using NetSuite, NetSuite Budgeting & Planning (preferred), QuickBooks, PayCor
Demonstrated experience using Microsoft Office productively, including proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and Outlook
Experience with upgrading systems, integrations, and new implementations (preferred)
Experience in industries: laboratory, R&D, biotechnology, light manufacturing, healthcare desired
Knowledge/Skills
Knowledge of GAAP and strong accounting background
Must be able to work independently, as well as, be a contributing team member
Excellent time management and communication skills; must be able to prioritize and meet deadlines, while being flexible as a start-up, high-growth environment requires
Customer-focused; ability to provide internal departments and external vendors with excellent service
Organized, analytical and detail-oriented
Solutions-oriented with the ability to assess processes and proactively identify opportunities for improvement
Ability to work both in team environments and as an individual contributor
Ability to maintain confidentiality in all areas of responsibility, in a professional and discreet manner
Working Conditions
Under standard working conditions, this position is based in our Santa Barbara, CA office. Due to COVID-19, remote work locations will be considered temporarily, but must be located in proximity to access or travel to the Santa Barbara, CA office as the business may require. Temporary remote work to be performed during normal corp business hours and within an environment conducive to professional standards and job duties.
Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
No strenuous physical activity
Ability to lift up to 15 pounds required
Serimmune, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
DISCLAIMER: The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work. It is not designed to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and responsibilities of an employee to this job.

Title: Tax Manager
job description:
Brickley DeLong is a full-service, West-Michigan based, public accounting and business consulting firm with offices in Muskegon, Grand Haven, Grand Rapids and Hart. We currently have opportunities for a Tax Manager both in our Muskegon and our Grand Rapids locations. The position requires the ability to manage a broad range of business and individual filings, supervise a team handling many projects simultaneously, and assisting with tax research and planning. The candidate should have eight or more years of public accounting experience with CPA required, Masters in Taxation preferred.
Job Summary / Responsibilities
As Tax Manager you will be directly involved with the compliance function of client engagements including the preparation and technical review of corporate, partnership and personal income tax returns.
Your role will include identifying tax planning calculations, research and consulting on complex tax matters, and assist the firm in process improvement and best practices.
You will manage and supervise multiple client engagements, must have the ability to work within strict deadlines without compromising excellent service.
Must possess strong leadership and staff development skills ensuring the future growth of the firm.
Strong emphasis on providing exceptional client service, building relationships and becoming the client's trusted advisor.
You should have a very strong working knowledge of tax software, CPA firm culture, and effective writing, communication and tax research skills.
Why Brickley DeLong
BD is a top 10 Firm in West Michigan. The right candidate will be an essential part of our team providing services in tax, consulting, assurance and more. At BD, you will be continually challenged to accept new responsibilities while upholding the highest level of integrity, innovation, and dedication to the firm and its clients.
We are committed to developing and rewarding our greatest asset, our employees. We value hard work at Brickley DeLong, but we recognize the significance of opportunities for growth and work-life balance. Our focus is not only on quality of work, but on quality of life. We believe that happy employees produce a strong work ethic, superb teamwork, and lasting client relationships.
Brickley DeLong offers a competitive salary and benefit package and provides excellent growth potential to the ideal candidate.

Job Summary
Our company was formed in the late 90s with our very first location being in Pahrump, Nye County, NV. Since then, we have expanded our footprint to include Lassen County, CA, Mendocino County, CA, and Lake County, CA. We have a great team and office atmosphere.
We are looking for a friendly, experienced accountant to head the accounting department in our Pahrump, NV office and provide support for our corporate office in California. You will be responsible for monthly processing of accounting records and for the preparation, reviewing, and analysis and preparation of financial reports for our Nevada group of companies. Furthermore, you will be responsible for managing the Nevada accounting team, as well as working with local government representatives to review CPI adjustments, contract changes, contract compliance and reporting, etc.
Our ideal candidate has in-depth knowledge and understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and daily accounting activities such as cash receipts, billing, receivables, payables and payroll, bank account reconciliation and cash management.
You should be able to work well with others as a team, and support, encourage, and train your team members.
Ultimately, you will play a vital role in our company’s Nevada office.

Prepare and analyze monthly and quarterly financial reports in accordance with GAAP; present findings to management

Assist human resources department
