Title: Budget and Accounting Manager
job description:
The City of Renton is looking for an experienced Budget and Accounting Manager for our Administrative Services department. This position will lead a team of analysts that focuses on the City's biennial budget, CAFR, CIP, grant administration and other accounting and finance functions. The ideal candidate will have the following education and experience:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or related field
5-8 years of progressively responsible experience in accounting, auditing, budgeting, financial analysis and public finance
Experience in municipal government highly preferred
2 years of supervisory experience in a similar role

Working for the City of Renton comes with an excellent benefits package, including:
Deferred compensation with the City contributing 4% of the employee's salary
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance at affordable rates
Paid leave for vacation, sick, ten holidays and two "personal" holidays a year
State of Washington Department of Retirement Systems Public Employee Retirement Systems (PERS) plan enrollment

JOB SUMMARY:
Considered a working manager, oversee a workgroup. Manage and oversee financial reporting and preparation, compliance, and internal controls over the City's assets and processes. Will have direct reports and may have indirect reports. Manage employee performance (promote, coach, mentor, and discipline); terminate in conjunction with a superior. Monitor and maintain a designated budget. Ensure department/strategic goals are implemented. Policy development, updates, interpretation, and administration.

SUPERVISION:
Reports to: Fiscal Services Director
Supervises: Senior Finance Analyst and Finance Analyst I/II/III

JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
Essential Functions:
Plan, organize, and manage all aspects of the financial reporting of the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report (CAFR) and biennial budget process for the City.
Recruit, hire, train, recognize, promote, coach, mentor, develop, evaluate, and discipline the performance of assigned staff. Terminations handled in conjunction with a superior.
Delegate/assign, prioritize, review, and ensure timely completion of duties of assigned staff.
Assist in establishing and implementing the goals of the department.
Prepare and control budgets; control and approve expenditures and capital purchases; monitor, prepare and submit periodic budget updates; monitor assigned performance measures.
Oversee the preparation of the interim, and biennial, budgets to include financial reports, statements, and analysis.
Manage the treasury operation, investments, and debt service.
Resolve interdepartmental, and interagency, fiscal processes, reporting, accounting discrepancies, and other matters as it relates to financial control involving complex transactions.
Provide technical expertise and data analysis to internal departments, and external stakeholders, on a variety of City financial matters and procedures.
Develop, research, and revise department policies, procedures, ordinances and other materials related to financial activities and operations; resolve work-related complaints and issues that cannot be addressed by staff.
Act as the liaison for the State Auditor's office during the annual audits of financial statements, annual single audit of grant reporting on the SEFA, and the accountability audit.
Analyze, review and prepare a variety of complex calculations, reports and data analyses related to financial operations.
Direct and monitor budgetary activities during the course of the budget year; provide feedback to Administrators and other management personnel as necessary.
Assure the accuracy of City accounting records and reports in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), GASB, BARS, and other state, local, and/or federal laws.
Act as the project manager on large system implementations, conversions, or general process improvements as it relates to financial systems.
Plan, develop and provide training to internal, and external, stakeholders on financial matters, systems, policies, and procedures.
Maintain regular, reliable, and punctual attendance, work evening and/or weekend hours as assigned, and travel as required.
Remain current with relevant technological advancements as it relates to field.
Standard Functions:
Represent the City at various regional meetings dealing with assigned areas of responsibility.
Perform the role of backup for the immediate supervisor and staff.
Perform related duties as assigned.
May be assigned to support critical city priorities during disasters or other emergencies.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Public or Business Administration, Finance or related field.
5-8 years of progressively responsible experience in budgeting, accounting, or finance.
Or 9-12 years of relevant education and experience.
2 years of supervisory experience.
Public sector experience preferred.
Successful passing of a required background check and credit check.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTS:
Use sound, logical, and ethical judgment to make recommendations to citywide staff.
Oral communication and presentation skills.
Written communication skills, ensuring correct grammar, spelling, punctuation and vocabulary.
Technical writing skills.
Interpersonal skills using tact, patience, and courtesy.
Effective, professional, and positive interactions with difficult individuals.
Understand and follow direction given.
Meet schedules and deadlines.
Accurate advanced mathematical skills.
Recordkeeping and data entry skills.
Report preparation and distribution skills.
Budget development and control skills.
Research and analytical skills.
Decision-making skills.
Conflict resolution and problem-solving skills.
Leadership skills.
Detail-oriented and organization skills.
Ability to:
Compose, proofread, and edit correspondence.
Work independently.
Negotiate viable solutions under a variety of circumstances.
Analyze situations accurately and adopt an effective course of action.
Generate complex reports.
Prepare financial analysis, projections and forecasts.
Review and evaluate complex data and make appropriate recommendations.
Develop solid internal control measures and provide oversight to ensure the City's assets are safeguarded and its records are accurate and complex.
Identify and resolve problems as it relates to, or affects the City's financial operations.
Knowledge of:
Methods, techniques and practices of maintaining complex financial records.
Governmental accounting, payroll principles and practices as prescribed by law, regulations, authoritative pronouncements, and the established standards of professional organizations.
Database management, development and reporting theory.
Financial and fiscal statistical, analytical, research and projection techniques.
Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and financial recording software.

WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The following represent the physical demands that must be met to successfully perform the essential functions of this job:
Work is performed in a typical office environment and involves moving throughout the facility and community.
Constantly operate a computer and other office equipment.
Frequent communication with City employees and customers.
Night meetings required.
Move items weighing up to 20 pounds on occasion.
Noise level is moderately quiet.
Approved reasonable accommodation requests will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Selection Procedure:
The City of Renton is dedicated to building an inclusive, informed city, with opportunities for all. In alignment with that goal, the City has adopted an anonymous application process that prevents hiring managers from seeing personal identifiers, including names, addresses, and other similar information. This eliminates the possibility of unintentional or implicit bias during the initial screening of applications. For that reason, you will not have the ability to attach any documents to your application, including a cover letter or resume. Please make sure to submit a complete, detailed, and updated job application.

Communication from the City of Renton:
We primarily communicate via e-mail during the recruitment process. E-mails from rentonwa.gov and/or governmentjobs.com should be placed on your safe domain list to ensure you receive notifications in a timely manner. As a precaution, you may also want to check your junk e-mail folders.

Title: 1.0FTE Accounting Manager - Ed Center
job description:
The position of Accounting Manager is done for the purpose(s) of providing up-to-date fiscal information for reference, audit, and/or compliance; ensuring appropriate revenues are generated, expenses are within budget limits and fiscal practices are followed; maintaining accurate account balances and complying with related policies, practices and/or regulations; determining feasibility of services with budget parameters; making recommendations regarding fiscal practices; and maximizing use of funds.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (These duties are a representative sample; position assignments may vary.)
Analyzes contracts and projects/costs for the purpose of determining feasibility of service within budget parameters, making recommendations and/or maximizing use of fund
Assists with budgeting and financial projections for the purpose of providing financial guidance and recommendations to Superintendent and/or Board
Develops reporting procedures and internal controls for the purpose of maintaining accurate records
Informs personnel regarding various procedures and program requirements for the purpose of providing necessary information for making decisions, taking appropriate action and/or complying with established fiscal guidelines
Instructs other accounting personnel for the purpose of informing them of current procedures and policies
Monitors fund balances of assigned programs and related financial activity for the purpose of ensuring that allocations are accurate, related revenues and generated, expenses are within budget limits and/or fiscal practices are followed
Prepares documentation for the purpose of providing written support and/or conveying information
Processes various fiscal information for the purpose of updating information and/or authorizing final action in compliance with accounting requirements
Recommends policies, procedures and/or actions on issues that relate to accounting functions for the purpose of providing direction and/or making decisions for the district
Researches discrepancies of financial information and/or documentation for the purpose of ensuring accuracy and adherence to procedures prior to processing
Supervises accounting technical staff for the purpose of maximizing the efficiency of the work force and meeting shift requirements
Supervises the maintenance of various fiscal information, files and records for the purpose of providing an up-to-date reference and audit trail for compliance
Assists director and other personnel as may be required for the purpose of supporting them in the completion of their work activities
Works under limited supervision using standardized practices and/or methods; directing other persons within a small work unit; and directing the use of budgeted funds within a work unit. Utilization of significant resources from other work units is sometimes required to perform the job’s functions.
Other duties as assigned

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (positions in this class typically require)
Bachelor’s degree in job related area preferred
Job related experience with specialized field is required

LICENSING REQUIREMENTS (positions in this class typically require):
None Required

KNOWLEDGE (position requirements at entry):
KNOWLEDGE is required to perform algebra and/or geometry; read technical information, compose a variety of documents, and/or facilitate group discussions; and analyze situations to define issues and draw conclusions. Specific knowledge required to satisfactorily perform the functions of the job includes; pertinent codes, policies, regulations and/or laws; standard accounting procedures.

SKILLS (position requirements at entry):
SKILLS are required to perform multiple, highly complex, technical tasks with a need to occasionally upgrade skills in order to meet changing job conditions. Specific skills required to satisfactorily perform the functions of the job include: communicate with individuals of varied cultural and educational backgrounds; plan and manage projects; utilize pertinent software applications.

ABILITY (position requirements at entry):
ABILITY is required to schedule activities, meetings, and/or events; routinely gather, collate, and/or classify data and use basic, job-related equipment. Flexibility is required to independently work with others in a wide variety of circumstances; analyze data utilizing a variety of complex processes; and operate equipment using a variety of standardized methods. Ability is also required to work with a wide diversity of individuals; work with data of widely varied types and/or purposes; and utilize specific, job-related equipment. In working with others, independent problem solving is required to analyze issues and create action plans. Problem solving with data requires analysis based on organizational objectives; and problem solving with equipment is limited. Specific abilities required to satisfactorily perform the functions of the job include: be attentive to detail; communicate with diverse groups; meet deadlines and schedules; record keeping; work under time constraints.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Positions in this class typically require: reaching, standing, walking, pushing, pulling, lifting, finger dexterity, grasping, talking, hearing, seeing, and repetitive motions.

Sedentary Work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met.

Incumbents may be subjected to moving mechanical parts, odors, chemicals, extreme temperatures, inadequate lighting, workspace restrictions, and intense noises.

NOTE:
The above job description is intended to represent only the key areas of responsibilities; specific position assignments will vary depending on the business needs of the department.

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
For over two decades, Kranz Consulting has been the recognized leader in providing superior financial consulting advisory services requested by CEO’s, Boards, CFO’s and the most prominent Venture Capital firms.
The company recognizes your contributions to our growth and allows you to participate in a comprehensive compensation program which includes PTO, 401K, health benefits and our bonus program (quarterly and annually). We encourage individual development, support continuous training (through various certification courses), provide mentors for your career goals and promote teamwork.
This position is a full time and/or part time working as an employee of Kranz Consulting while providing part time consulting services to our clients. The Accounting Manager position working inside our client companies is a hands on position that works very closely with the senior management of our clients. In this capacity you will report to the interim CFO/CEO or other client company staff.
If you are a seasoned professional with excellent interpersonal skills coupled with strong experience and skills in the area of Finance & Accounting, we are looking for you.
Responsibilities include:
Accounts Receivable – Manage the company’s invoicing process to its customers, insure timely billing and collections processing.
Revenue Recognition –
Analyze contracts with customers, establish and maintain a process to monitor and report revenue according to GAAP. Insure accuracy and timeliness of reporting revenue
Manage and reconcile add deferred revenue subsidiary ledgers to the general ledger on a monthly basis
Bookings – Establish a process for monitoring and managing monthly bookings from the various sales sources
Payroll – Prepare and process payroll for our client companies
Cash Management – Manage the company’s bank activities, prepare cash burn report, insure accuracy of cash reporting
Accounts Payable – Manage the company’s expense management process from vendor invoicing, and insure timely payments are made.
Equity Management – Insure the proper recording of all equity activity for both common and preferred stock transactions
Ensure financial records are maintained in compliance with accepted policies and procedures, maintain month end account reconciliations.
Financial Reporting –
Manage the month end close process, provide monthly Balance Sheet, P&L and Cash flow reports in accordance with GAAP
Establish and maintain a journal entry system that provides proper supporting information for all JE’s made to the accounting records
Prepare monthly department level reports, coordinate with the various managers a review of their financial information to insure accuracy and spending within plan
Budgeting and Planning
Assist in the preparation of and monitor the company’s actual performance against the current budget and business plan
Insure that the budgets are entered into the accounting system properly to allow ease of reporting
Tax filings - Insure timely filing of all regulatory reporting including local, state and federal taxation forms
Manage the audit process
Minimum Qualifications:
Organizational Skills
Communication Skills both written and oral
Detail Oriented
Analytical
3 years plus of previous accounting manager level experience
3+ years of cost accounting and inventory experience
Prior experience working within manufacturing, biotech, or biopharma industries
BA degree preferably in accounting
QuickBooks or Peachtree accounting system experience
Outstanding PC skills with Word and Excel
A Plus:
Previous experience with Credit Card processing for on line sales
Previous experience with Sales Force.com
Previous experience with on line expense management systems
Previous high tech experience

Title: Controller
job description:
The Controller is accountable for the accounting operations of Prime MSO. The individual has adequate support of staff to handle day-to-day accounting transactions, allowing the Controller the role of management and strategic development. The role involves direct supervision as well has involvement with selected departments within Prime MSO.
The scope of responsibilities is not limited to items listed below; the position is also responsible for cash management and risk management and works alongside the Chief Financial Officer on financial reporting and unique projects to enhance current operations.
Functions:
Safeguard assets and assure accurate and timely recording of all transactions by implementing disciplines of internal audits, controls and checks across all departments.
Manage the accuracy and productivity of day-to-day activities of accounts payable, cash disbursements, invoicing/billing, customer credits and collections, payroll, perpetual inventory integrity, fixed asset records, general & entity accounting, cost accounting, Human Resources, and Operations etc.
Develop, improve and issue timely monthly financial records for Board of Directors and Officers.
Assure financial plans are consistent with organizational goals
Provide financial analysis tools to evaluate company ventures or special projects, programs, capital expenditures, products costing, etc. when necessary.
Develop and maintain healthy relationships with certain third parties and vendors.
Interface with outside audit firms(s), banks and lessors, casualty/liability insurance agent(s), credit card companies, and collection agencies.
Provide a visionary and leadership implementation role on behalf of Finance and Human Resources to all departments, creating a well-respected and sought after department goal.
Report to Chief Executive Officers and Chief Financial Officer when necessary in writing and verbally.
Coordinates with Director of Billing on special projects and operational development.
Complete projects and duties assigned by CFO.
Management:
Maintain a documented system of accounting policies and procedures.
Manage outsourced functions.
Oversee the operations of the accounting department, including the design of an organizational structure adequate for achieving the department's goals and objectives.
Oversee the accounting operations of subsidiary corporations, especially their control systems, transaction-processing operations, and policies and procedures.
Working Conditions:
Primarily in an office environment. Will be expected to travel as needed to company subsidiaries, as well as to potential acquires to conduct due diligence. Periodic weekend or evening work is expected.
Transactions:
Ensure that accounts payable are paid in a timely manner.
Ensure that all reasonable discounts are taken on accounts payable.
Ensure that accounts receivable are collected promptly.
Ensure that periodic bank reconciliations are completed.
Ensure that required debt payments are made on a timely basis.
Maintain the chart of accounts.
Maintain an orderly accounting filing system.
Maintain a system of controls over accounting transactions.
Reporting:
Issue timely and complete financial statements.
Coordinate the preparation of the corporate annual report.
Recommend benchmarks against which to measure the performance of company operations.
Calculate and issue financial and operating metrics.
Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts.
Calculate variances from the budget and report significant issues to management.
Provide for a system of management cost reports.
Provide financial analyses as needed, in particular for capital investments, pricing decisions, and contract negotiations.
Language and Mathematical Skills:
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations; ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries and complaints.
Effective and persuasive presentation skills on controversial or complex topics to top management, public groups and/or board of directors.
Must be able to calculate figures and amounts for all bookkeeping, payroll, budgets, statistical analysis and probability statements. Controller must use the utmost discretion in all presentations/correspondence and communication for staff, Board of Directors and Executive Directors.
Compliance:
Coordinate the provision of information to external auditors for the annual audit.
Monitor debt levels and compliance with debt covenants.
Comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Business Administration, or equivalent major
Minimum of 5 years of relevant business experience; progressively responsible for a major company or division of large corporation
Preference will be given to candidates with the Certified Public Accountant or Certified Management Accountant designations
Proficiency in GAAP
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Ability to Commute/Relocate:
Glendale, CA 91203 (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Accounting: 5 years (Preferred)
Work Location:
One location

Title: CAFR Division Manager
job description:
Description and Functions



Open Until Filled

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

This position will be the manager of the Comprehensive Annual Financial Reporting (CAFR) Division of the Wyoming State Auditor’s Office. This is a supervisory position. The Wyoming State Auditor is the chief comptroller, fiscal officer, and payroll officer for the State of Wyoming. The CAFR Division prepares the statutorily required Comprehensive Annual Financial Report for the State of Wyoming, as well as entering appropriations into proper funds, preparing updates of revenues and expenditures, coordinating with other state agencies for reporting to the State Auditor’s Office, and ensuring the office complies with Generally Accepted Accounting Procedures (GAAP) and Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) requirements for governmental accounting. The position is part of the State Auditor’s Office's policy team and is an at-will position.

Human Resource Contact: Susan Green 307-777-3741

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The listed functions are illustrative only and are not intended to describe every function which may be performed in the job level.
Oversees the timely and accurate preparation of the State of Wyoming’s Comprehensive Annual Financial Report.
Coordinates and monitors timely submission of information by agency fiscal personnel.
Serves as the liaison between external independent auditors and state agencies.
Performs supervisory duties over the CAFR division, including work allocation, cross-training, and performance evaluations for four employees.
Coordinates and works with other division managers within the office and is an active member of the State Auditor’s Office leadership team.
Loads all appropriations from each legislative session into the uniform accounting system operated by the State Auditor’s Office, taking into account the legislative intent and proper fund type under GASB and GAAP.
Oversees formal and informal training for other state agency personnel on accounting principles, new GASBs, and system developments.
It is responsible for corrective action plans resulting from audit findings related to the State Auditor’s Office internal controls in accounting.
Attends meetings of the National Association of State Comptrollers and functions as office liaison for information requests.
Reviews proposed legislation, provides information to the Legislative Service Office (LSO) personnel and communicates potential legislative impacts to the State Auditor’s Office staff.
Evaluates options available in the uniform accounting system for improved efficiency in accounting and financial reporting operations.
Evaluates workflow within the office and other state agencies to improve efficiency in interagency processes.
Participates in budget preparation and strategic planning for office.
Develops policies and procedures governing the manner in which financial transactions are entered into the uniform accounting system to ensure compliance with GASB.
Managers the State Auditor’s Office pre-audit functions and processes.
Other duties as directed.

Qualifications


PREFERENCES:



Preference may be given to applicants with a Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree in accounting or related fields with two or more years of progressive experience, OR;
Preference may be given to applicants with five or more years of advanced accounting experience.
Preference may be given to applicants with a Certified Public Accountant’s (CPA) License.
Preference may be given to applicants with experience in governmental accounting.

KNOWLEDGE:
Knowledge of governmental accounting and extensive knowledge of GAAP, including applying accounting principles and educating other fiscal personnel in other state entities.
Knowledge of and ability to apply and implement GASB requirements.
Ability to meet deadlines required by state statutes.
Ability to communicate clearly and cooperatively.
Ability and willingness to communicate effectively with numerous fiscal employees throughout state government.
Knowledge of audit processes as an accountant for an entity being audited or from experience in public accounting.
Excellent analytical ability to evaluate processes and make changes as needed for compliance with required accounting standards and increased efficiency and accuracy.
Ability to coordinate diverse groups in state government to achieve accuracy and efficiency in fund allocation, loading of appropriations into the system, and provision of data by those agencies for the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report for the state.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

None - See "Preferences"
Necessary Special Requirements


NOTES:
FLSA: Exempt
This is an At-Will position

Supplemental Information


003-State Auditor's Office - CAFR Division

https://sao.wyo.gov/

Click here to view the State of Wyoming Classification and Pay Structure.

URL: http://agency.governmentjobs.com/wyoming/default.cfm

The State of Wyoming is an Equal Opportunity Employer and actively supports the ADA and reasonably accommodates qualified applicants with disabilities.
Class Specifications are subject to change, please refer to the A & I HRD Website to ensure that you have the most recent version.

Title: Supervisor, Payroll
job description:

Also, ensuring adherence to company policies and procedures as well as compliance with internal control policies, and supporting Accounting Managers with various accounting, financial and operational analysis and reporting.


What you will be doing:
Establishes or ensures execution of internal controls over the payroll processes.
Supervises and participates in the operation and maintenance of the payroll systems and their integration with other company and vendor systems.
Provides the primary review of key payroll transactions and their recording in the general ledger.
Supervises the reconciliation of select payroll related general ledger accounts and employee balances at our payroll partners.
Supervises audit of the qualified retirement plan and various payroll related testings.
Supervises and participates in the production of salaries budgets and forecasts.
Provides management with payroll key performance indicators and causal analyses explaining differences between estimates and results.
Ensures processes and procedures are in place to ensure business continuity.
Assist with other requests as needed.

Relationship Management
Builds strong relationships with peers, other departments, and managers to best meet company goals and objectives.
Maintains industry and professional relationships to remain current with best practices.

What you will bring:
5-8 years’ experience with payroll administration
Intermediate knowledge of MS Excel
Experience with ADP Workforce Now and timekeeping software (Kronos or ADP Time-Keeping)
Certified Payroll Professional or Fundamental Payroll Certification preferred
Experience with multi-state payroll preferred
Budgeting and forecasting experience
Epson America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability and protected veteran status, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
Description
The incumbent performs a variety of complex and highly technical accounting activities dealing with the financial accounting and reporting of the City. The incumbent applies authoritative standards to practical applications and implements changes as required. The incumbent exercises independent judgment involving complex problems. The incumbent supervises and evaluates assigned staff. Incumbent may be required to work in excess of standard forty hour work week during critical periods with the approval of the Department Director.
Examples of Duties
Prepares and reviews journal entries for accuracy and completeness.
Assists in planning and organizing the City's annual audit.
Compiles detailed analyses and reconciliations for annual audit.
Prepares various statements, schedules and narrative sections of the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report.
Reviews draft financial statements, records and reports before submitting.
Answers external auditor's questions regarding financial statements and the City's financial reporting system.
Provides assistance as needed during the preparation of the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report and the annual audit.
Coordinates with other departments regarding budgets and accounting for funds and projects.
Communicates effectively. Compiles technical reports for various financial requirements.
Prepares Requests for Proposals for financial operations, evaluates responses and prepares recommendations.
Reads, interprets and applies technical data and governmental accounting principles and practices as they relate to City operations.
Prepares new schedules, templates, and departmental practices required to implement authoritative changes.
Trains Finance staff on accounting applications and provides technical assistance as needed.
Collaborates with City staff to ensure compliance with all financial policies and procedures.
Resolves complex accounting issues and works with Assistant Finance Director to implement changes as necessary.
Plan, assigns and directs work of directly supervised staff.
Provides accounting information relating to the preparation of the annual budget and capital improvement plan.
Provides backup and support during the absence of staff.
Prepares complex detailed worksheets via spreadsheet software (i.e., Excel).
Responsible for providing maintenance of financial software systems.
Assists with the implementation and upgrade of new financial software, training of users, and development of documentation.
Researches and writes reports to enhance financial reporting and efficiency of departmental operations.
Conducts specialized studies and surveys and reports results to senior management.
May serve in the capacity of Acting Assistant Finance Director.
Performs other assigned duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business from an accredited college or university with concentration in accounting classes (Proof must be uploaded with application).
Five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in governmental accounting or finance with at least three (3) years of experience in a supervisory capacity.

Licenses, Certifications or Registrations:
Must possess and maintain a valid Florida driver’s license.
Certified Government Finance Officer (CGFO) certification is preferred or must be obtained as soon as eligible under the program requirements.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge and understanding of principles and practices of governmental accounting.
Knowledge of the laws, rules and regulations regarding financial record keeping in the State of Florida.
Skill in the use of computer based data information systems.
Skill in the use of personal computers.
Skill in presenting complicated subject matters both orally, graphically and in writing.
Knowledge of supervisory practices and procedures.
Skill in analyzing complex situations accurately and adopting effective and reasonable courses of action.
Skill in the advanced use of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook) and Adobe
Ability to comprehend, analyze, and implement governmental accounting standards.
Ability to prepare and maintain complex financial reports.
Ability to train and develop professional staff.
Ability to work quickly and accurately to meet deadlines.
Ability to understand the functionality of and use financial software and all related applications with limited direction.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to maintain a good working relationship with associates, employees, and the public.
Ability to multitask.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Ability to see, read, and comprehend writing and computer printouts.
Ability to communicate clearly both orally and in writing
Ability to lift and carry materials not to exceed 20 lbs.
Ability to operate office equipment such as a telephone, computer, calculator, and copy machine.
Ability to stand for periods of time not to exceed 30 minutes at one time.
Ability to sit for long periods of time not to exceed two (2) hours at one time.
Ability to stoop, kneel and reach overhead for books or supplies.
Ability to control behavior when encountering stressful situations, such as irate, abusive or loud customers, or short deadlines.
Ability to perform at a very high level of accuracy with short deadlines.
Ability to maintain high level of concentration.
Ability to be flexible and change priorities at a moment's notice.
Ability to operate City vehicle’s in a safe and efficient manner.

The City of Melbourne offers a generous benefit package to include:
100% City paid medical insurance for employee only; coverage available for family
Health Insurance opt-out incentive for employees with other medical coverage
Dental
Life Insurance in the amount of 1 times your annual salary
Additional life insurance to include coverage for your spouse and child(ren)
Short-term disability
Long-term disability
Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Account
Employee Assistance Program
Wellness Program
457 Deferred Compensation
Retirement Plans (FRS, local plan for Police and Fire personnel)
Paid Holidays
Tuition Reimbursement

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
OCONOMOWOC AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT
Role Description
JOB TITLE: Accounting Manager
Reports to: Director of Business Services
Hours/Days: 8 hours per day/12-months per year
Salary: Commensurate with experience
**Only online application accepted to WECAN (https://wecan.education.wisc.edu). Create an account in the WECAN support staff section and send it to WECAN vacancy #96363.**
SUMMARY:
The Accounting Manager is responsible for all areas related to accounting and financial reporting of OASD’s $68M budget. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining accounting principles, practices and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial statements. The Accounting Manager supervises two staff accountants and is responsible for managing the team to ensure that work is properly allocated and completed in a timely and accurate manner. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, financial reporting, process improvement projects, year-end audit preparation, and the support of budget and forecast activities. The Accounting Manager reports to the Director of Business Services and has contact with employees with diverse backgrounds, skills sets, and job responsibilities which requires strong interpersonal communication skills both written and verbal.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES:
Accounting – Processing & Review
Update and maintain Chart of Accounts / WUFAR master
Investigate, identify, determine accounting for new transactions (debt, leases, fiscal agency, charter schools, etc.)
Post journal entries
Review journal entries from accounts payable and accounting
Post payroll adjustments
Review and approve requisitions
Review and approve check registers
Review and code various Business Office invoices for payment – insurance, fees, OAC, dues, HR services
Prepare Board Business Committee materials: Run check registers, wire transfers, ach’s, summary wire transfers, pcard summary, pcard transactions, financials, OAC summary, various other depending on agenda
Prepare, report, and pay OAC sales tax (monthly)
Process prenotes, payroll files, vendor ap ach’s, and employee ach’s
Review bank reconciliations
Review the SBS Medicaid Reporting done by Student Services prior to submission (quarterly and annual)
Assist principal, administrators, and others with budget inquires, concerns, account code issues and questions
Assist payroll and HR with account code questions and budget concerns
Post weekly pcard transactions
Financial Analysis
Various budget, cost, revenue analysis as requested or needed by Director of Business Services
Maintain OAC performance summary and financials (monthly)
Copier analysis: Maintain spreadsheet of inventory, budget prep, invoice review and approval, lease renewal
Computer/tech device leases and purchases: maintain lease spreadsheet, annual spend/budget, annual invoices on pcard
Capital leases – maintain spreadsheet, record annual entries for principal and interest, record annual gross-up for new leases
Annual cashflow borrowing – prepare cashflow analysis for the year, (if borrowing is required: prepare legal documents, work with financial advisor and attorney, record collection, make and record payoff)
Various project analysis of budget versus tracking of actual costs
Creating the summer school payroll spreadsheet and course expenditure budget costing – working with Curriculum & Instruction and Complete the Summer School Course Fee/Cost Budget Report
Complete the Fund 80 expense allocation for utilities, custodial staffing, and OAC operations
Manage the allowable costs that can be allocated to Fund 80
Accounting Management
Lead accounts payable specialist and internal auditor/accountant
Coordinate audit
Prepare and analyze liability schedules
Compile annual financials – ensure accuracy, timeliness, and completeness
Compile federal and state grant/aid schedules
Coordinate and ensure timely annual CUSIP filing by PMA (financial advisor)
Annual Excise Tax filing (ACA requirement)
Manage Skyward Financials – authority, access, financial access, account clearance, account groups, purchase groups, set up next year requisitions, po groups, wire transfer #’s, ach #’s
Maintain cash balances, process transfer requests, make investment decisions, maintain banking relationships, and implement new products and services
Pcard Coordination: Limit changes, Declines, limit review, new card requests, card distribution, training, closed accounts, collect cards, overall program administration
Property tax levy- prepare and maintain spreadsheet of levy, payments, and receivables; verify all payments are received timely and code for deposit to appropriate accounts/funds
1099 submissions, ACA submissions, fixed asset reporting, student fees, retiree inventory, and pcard audit – high level oversight
Maintain the retiree benefit spreadsheet in conjunction with HR, payroll, and benefits specialist and Prompt processing of annual retiree benefits payment
Participate in annual Erate meetings and assist Technology department if/as necessary
Review substitute, transportation/gas, and fund 21 analyses prepared by Accounts Payable Specialist
Assist with AA training – preparation, coordination, and instruction
Manage food service provider relations: manage Fund 50 budget, daily food service operations (meet with provide to review program performance on a regular basis)
File the monthly food service meal claims (compile the monthly meal reports with the Food Service Manager)
Debt service management: maintain debt spreadsheets (Fund 38 and Fund 39), debt service payments (2x/year), long term debt roll-forward, annual debt summary for audit (including capital leases), respond to various debt inquiries
OPEF grants – create account codes, communicate deadlines and accounting with recipients and administrators/principals, coordinate expenditure reporting and fund collection with OPEF
Should referendum occur – compile, maintain, and manage construction financials and debt postings and compliance requirements
Various project assistance – such as RevTrak, 403b, Pcard, GASB implementation, Electronic document storage and workflow
Business Office process improvements – drive, oversee, and implement
Attend monthly Board Finance, Operations, and Advancement meetings
Budget Compilation
Assist with various budget preparation, compilation, and analysis tasks as directed by Director of Business Services
Budget: non-personnel templates - prepare, distribute, compile; Business Office non-personnel budget
Calculate site budget allocations and site year-end carryover allocations
Communicate final non-personnel budgets for sites and departments
Attend all non-personnel budget meetings
Update the Student Fee Schedule using information from Accounts Payable Specialist and Internal Auditor
Oversee (May/June) and update (November) the site and non-personnel budgets into Skyward
Enter expense budget into Skyward – Fund 21, 38, 39, 50, and 73
Reporting & Other
Complete various DPI reports: Budget Report, Annual Report, Special Ed. Budget Report, and Special Ed Annual Report
Manage the September 3rd Friday and January 2nd Friday student enrollment counts (update and distribute the instructions, enter the site enrollment counts into compilation spreadsheet, review the open enrollment information with Student Services, and submit to DPI in conjunction with Director of Business Services)
Facilitate the Online Registration process (schedule meetings, provide financial input/perspective)
Compile and enter annual food service financial report to DPI (USDA)
Run reports for annual workers compensation audit
Run monthly OAC ticket sales report for sales tax reporting
Identify annual IRS mileage rate to be utilized and communicate – update Web Expense Reporting categories using this rate
Various communications: EOY purchasing, beginning of the year procedures/notes, IRS rate, etc.

Detail oriented

Dedication, commitment to responsibilities
Ability to recognize process improvement/efficiency opportunities and implement project solutions
Experience with various Microsoft software, Google applications, technology tools, and financial software packages for data entry, information analysis, and report preparation required

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
Our client, a successful bookkeeping firm in Gilbert, is in need of an Accounting Manager to assist in their growing business. This individual will be very hands-on with clients and will occasionally require limited travel to job sites. Candidates must be very computer savvy and comfortable with QuickBooks accounting software (both Desktop and Online), and a whiz on Excel. The firm has a very family-like culture and offers some flexibility in the work schedule and competitive benefits.
Candidate needs to be hands on, and easily be able to adapt to clients needs and evolving roles. As a representative of the company, you will display professionalism in both your appearance and demeanor, and be willing to learn and execute on new tasks as they are assigned. You must be disciplined enough to work independently with minimal supervision. You will be expected to complete certain assigned tasks and objectives each month. Candidates will have a great attitude, be easy to work with, not be polarizing in their opinions or actions.
Attention to detail is a key factor in this role. You must be responsible and trustworthy, and be capable of passing a background check.
Duties/Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Bookkeeping for multiples companies
Produce accurate financial reports and be able to talk through the results with owners
Payroll processing and understanding how payroll taxes work
Ability to research discrepancies and identify and solve problems
TPT tax filings
Correspondence with clients, vendors, and others
Job requirements:
Attention to DETAIL is a MUST!
3-5 years minimum QuickBooks Desktop AND Online experience REQUIRED
College degree in an accounting or finance field REQUIRED
CPA certification PREFERRED
Strong understanding of payroll processing
Savvy computer skills; you should know Excel inside and out
Strong administrative organization skills
Hardworking, dependable, self-motivated, and responsible
Great communication and social skills are a must!
Occasional travel, sometimes out of state, will be required
The company offers a casual and friendly atmosphere, but you are expected to be professional, both in communications and in appearance.
Compensation based on experience.

Title: Accounting Manager
job description:
Oversee day-to-day activities of accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger entries, and financial statement preparation.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES:
Prepares timely and accurate reports of financial results for a monthly and year end close by monitoring and analyzing the accounting data.
Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
Interacts with outside independent auditors in preparing the Authority’s annual financial report by providing external auditors with requested data and assist them with preparation of the annual audit
Assures compliance with financial regulatory reporting requirements.
Maintains budget and cost allocation systems. Maintains accounting systems.
Administers the collection of grant funds from the FAA, the PA State Bureau of Aviation and other grant sources with assistance of the Deputy Director of Finance.
Administers depreciation records of all airports fixed assets.
Oversee Accounts Payable entry (approving postings by the Accountant I).
Oversee SARAA’s Accounts Receivable system of billing tenants and others for rents, utilities, commissions, landing fees and all other airline & non-airline charges.
Responsible for the initial collection efforts of Accounts Receivable.
Updates capital cash analysis monthly
Periodically suggest receivable write-offs in coordination with the Property Manager.
Update Navision tenant records as necessary.
Oversees the recording of daily parking revenues into the accounting system
Administer and oversee all credit card merchant service accounts.
Review Navision to ensure entries made by all have been allocated correctly. If not prepare entry for corrections.
Responsible for all Passenger Facility Charge (PFC) record keeping including reconciling with quarterly reports and bank account.
Oversee and approve the recording of biweekly payroll
Ensure employee retirement funds are paid timely (within 7 days of pay date)
Reconcile employee withholding and retirement general ledger accounts quarterly
Prepares special reports upon request from other departments.
Prepares weekly AP check run for approval
Assist in the development and implementation of new procedures to enhance the workflow of the department.
Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
Represents the organization by assisting in developing then supporting the strategic direction, priorities, objectives, vision, mission and values of the Airport Authority.
Performs complementary customer service functions consistent with airport customer service standards.
Performs any other duty or assignment delegated by proper authority.
SUPERVISION:

This position oversees account payable and receivable staff.

QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree (BA) in accounting from a four-year college or university and three years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Considerable accounting systems experience preferred but not required. CPA or other professional accounting certification a plus.

Required Licenses, Certificates, Conditions:

A valid PA driver’s license with a good driving record or ability to obtain PA license within 30 days of hire date. Ability to pass a 10-year background and criminal investigation in order to be issued an Airport Identification Badge.

Title: Controller
job description:
About US…
FDS Manufacturing Company is a family owned company that started in 1950 and has grown into a major manufacturer of Industrial and Agricultural packaging on the West Coast. Headquartered in Pomona, California. FDS Manufacturing Co. produces high quality and eco-friendly standard and custom packaging. www.fdsmfg.com
The Role…Controller
Manage accounting and finance functions for FDS Manufacturing Co., Inc. The Controller will be responsible in managing all aspects of accounting; billing, financial statements, general ledger, cost accounting, accounts payable, accounts receivable, budgeting, tax compliance, inventory accounting, revenue recognition, and various special analysis.
The Controller must be defined by a focus on execution, strong bias for action, decisiveness, a sense of urgency, and problem solve and plan.
This position requires multi-tasking, the preparation of financial statements, profitability and cash flow analysis, account reconciliations, and forecasting.
To start the Controller will have a keen focus on the Company inventory control process and maintenance.
Manage and coordinate month-end and year-end closing process; prepare income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis
Analyze variances and communicates explanations to management with recommended actions
Cost Accounting: Analyze Bill of Materials (BOM), investigate cycle counting variances and resolve issues, in conjunction with the Operations Team
As a key member of the Management team, the Controller will report to the President.
Controller Job Requirements and Qualifications
· Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business administration with an emphasis in Accounting, or a related field
· Ideal candidate will have 5 – 10 years of experience as a Controller in a Manufacturing Environment
Candidates with Finance experience in a manufacturing environment will first be reviewed
· Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Certified Management Accountant (CMA) license preferred but not required
· Excellent computer skills; experience in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite.
· Exceptional knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, cost accounting and cost control principles, and acceptable accounting principles
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to work and effectively communicate with all levels within the Company
· Advanced knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting best practices, laws, standards, and state/national regulations
· Analytical ability to develop and implement improvements or recommendations

Title: NOC Security Engineer
job description:
APR Consulting, Inc. has been engaged to identify a Network Engineer (Must have valid and current DOD Secret Security Clearance)
Location: Cary, NC 27513
Title: Network Engineer
Duration: 9 months or longer
Pay Rate: $30 to 35/hr. on W2

JOB DESCRIPTION:

USARC – Network Engineer

This position is responsible for Tier II/III monitoring and initial triage in a WAN/LAN network environment that typically links to numerous computer platforms, operating systems and network topologies (Full managed servicers to wallplate). Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for customer support of complex and diverse systems in a 7 X 24 environment. Work will be required on all shifts (1st, 2nd and 3rd), weekday, weekends, evenings and Holidays as needed.

Engineer will be responsible for the following tasks:
Proactive Monitoring of customer networks management tools to identify network anomalies and faults within the USARC network.
Responding and perform Tier II and Tier III triage of the network alarms utilizing the available network tools and systems.
Full ownership and management of Network hardware including WAN Routers and LAN Switches
Configuration and change management of all network hardware
Create customer trouble tickets on outages identified via network management systems and tools
Test and isolate physical level circuit issues using Verizon tools
Telco Local Loop and customer in-house wiring
Test and repair hardware issues in the customer WAN/LAN environment
Coordinate multiple vendor dispatches for repair at customer premise
Provide customer status of ongoing issues; communicate via phone/email/ticket notes with customer POCs
Understanding of ITIL terminology – ITIL Certification preferred
Experience with VoIP – Cisco Call Manager and Call Manager Express required
Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for customer support of complex and diverse systems in a 7 X 24 environment. The successful candidate will work to ensure network and network management environment is reliable to meet predefined service levels. The candidate will perform testing and diagnostic procedures on various vendor equipment and circuit testing according to published standards and will assemble and/or tests transmission equipment and monitor housekeeping alarms per specifications. The candidate must have previous experience, possess excellent communication skills both written and verbal. Telecommunications/Electronics Certificate; Cisco Certification required
Hands on experience with Cisco routers and switches required
Cable/Wire Certification; knowledge of the following tools:
Computer Associates (CA) Service Desk
CA Spectrum
E-Health
Work with LECs on loop acceptance. Test and troubleshoot supported products, perform customer facing hot cuts. Handle calls from internal/external customers in an ACD environment. The candidate must pass multiple drug tests in addition pass a security clearance and background investigations. The ideal candidate should also demonstrate, as it would apply to network transport and multiplexing, a general working / in-depth knowledge of Cisco equipment. The candidate must possess a minimum of 5-7 years experience.

REQUIREMENTS:
5 to 7 years WAN/LAN Networking experience or Network Security preferably in a network operations management center
Must have valid and current DoD SECRET security clearance
Must be flexible to work in a 7 X 24 environment across all shifts including weekends and holidays.
Experience with Cisco and Juniper routers and switches is required
DOD 8570.01 Compliance required
CCNA/CCENT certification
Security+ Certification required
Technical Certifications required
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

We pay weekly every Friday, have direct deposit, and offer a competitive benefits package: Medical, Dental Vision, 401k plan, etc.
At a minimum, a 7-year background check, education verification, employment verification, and drug screen will be conducted upon hire. Your suitability for employment is contingent upon successfully passing these required pre-employment screenings.
Our client is hiring quickly so if you are excited about this opportunity, feel that your experience, attitude, and abilities would be a great fit, apply today! We’re excited to work with you.
INDENG

Title: Data Center Engineer
job description:
Job Summary:
The Computer Facilities and Environmental Branch (CFEB) is responsible for short and long-range data center space allocation and resource planning, mainframe hardware installation, and hardware manipulation of IT equipment in all of these locations.
The computer operations centers support the programmatic, administrative, management information, statistical application systems, telecommunications network, electronic messaging system, and computer infrastructure and telecommunications equipment for the customer.
The contractors shall support the facilities management of the customer’s raised-floor computer room environments. The contractors shall assist in developing and implementing facilities for both mainframe and open systems.
Duties & Responsibilities
Duties will include site development and maintenance in support of the following: any approved customer projects for open systems, mainframe support, data cabling, vendor engagement, Business Continuity, and HVAC oversight for the various offices.
Technicians will perform all IT-related equipment installation, removal, or maintenance, along with any environmental changes.
The contractor shall analyze and make recommendations for all hardware installations with regard to the physical and logical constraints of the hardware requirements, utilizing state-of-the-art technology in network configurations and physical planning.
The contractor shall troubleshoot problem resolution issues.
The contractor shall document the existing environment, including CAD drawings, and perform computer facilities space and environmental planning.
The contractor shall provide analysis regarding power utilization and impact on cooling capacity, resolve network problem situations, and manage ongoing configuration decisions relating to the physical layout of the supported network infrastructure system.
The contractor shall recommend physical location and cabling configurations of the hardware and facilitates implementation.
The contractor shall install single-mode fiber, multi-mode fiber, RJ45 Terminable, InfiniBand, and any other cables utilized in the IT infrastructure..
The contractor shall prepare designated work orders, as necessary, to modify the facility for installation of network equipment.
The contractor shall install and uninstall equipment and provide status updates regarding the completeness of installation.
The contractor shall maintain equipment inventories on the customer SharePoint site.
The contractor shall update and develop specialized information reports as directed. Panel schedules would be an example of a specialized report.
The contractor shall configure, implement and provide training associated with DCOI (DataCenter Optimization Initiative) and RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) asset management solutions.
The contractor shall plan the installation of mainframe and Open Systems equipment; to include all facility related activities, i.e. power, cabling, air circulation, etc.
The contractor shall develop detailed mainframe migration plans to include a step-by-step approach to the relocation and delivery of hardware systems and equipment to the computer room, according to timeframes and parameters established by the customer project schedules.
The contractor shall develop complete site preparation documents for designated raised floor areas. The contractor shall complete these documents using either Microsoft Word or Excel format.
The contractor shall develop all documentation to request building modifications/alterations necessary to install and operate hardware at the proposed site. Documentation shall include power requirements, panel schedules, and scope of work. The contractor shall physically verify that all facilities are properly prepared, prior to the installation of hardware into such facilities.
The contractor shall facilitate support activities which include certification of the following:
HVAC systems
Raised floor load ratings
Verification of communications cable distance specification compliance
Placement of floor tile cutout
Layout of chilled water lines and plan conformance to local codes
Removal of floor tiles
Physical movement/placement of the equipment
The contractor shall perform on-site inspection of the following: electrical service (including panel loads, outlets, and power and grounding requirements), Uninterruptible Power Supplies, HVAC requirements (including humidity levels and supplemental requirements for equipment), security, and fire detection systems.
The contractor shall prepare the following: electrical service requirements, guidelines for determining power requirements and availability, guidelines for determining HVAC requirements and availability, guidelines for determining space requirements, guidelines for determining optimum configurations and layout, and guidelines for determining cable requirements and lengths. Guidelines should be in Microsoft Word format.
The contractor shall verify the following: cable layouts, lengths, and labeling of cables, physical layout of hardware and cables in accordance with proposed configuration charts. The contractor shall document this information, detailing the IT hardware installation, in the CAPRS system.
The contractor shall pack, insure, ship, and receive designated office/computer equipment to/from designated locations using a common carrier or other means agreed to by the customer.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum of 1 years of experience in Data Center Facilities Ops
Requires a bachelor's degree (4 years’ experience may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree)
Due to the large number of equipment installations and projected incoming equipment, contractor personnel shall be capable of performing the duties described with minimal supervision within ninety-days from the start of this task.
The contractor shall be able to utilize both mechanical (hand tools, drills, etc.) and electronic (meters, oscilloscopes etc.) devices to perform assigned functions.
Duties frequently require lifting or manipulating heavy equipment (Some equipment can weigh well over 100 pounds) and require manipulation with mechanical lifts or other similar lifting devices.
The contractor shall have adequate knowledge of telecommunication links and modes of data transmission, including all cable configurations.
The contractor must be capable of manufacturing various cables on short notice, with provided supplies.
The contractor’s expertise shall include installation of servers, routers, switches, etc., and all associated hardware, cable installation, and housing of equipment in cabinets, with the primary emphasis on safety.
The contractor shall have an understanding of the setup and workings of a multi-platform environment, which includes knowledge of all types of mainframe equipment (i.e. EC12 Processors or latest processors), different types of DASD and vendors, tape drives, and tape silos.
The selected applicant will be subject to a background check and drug testing.
Selected candidate must be able to pass a background check and be eligible to receive a Public Trust level clearance. We will facilitate the clearance process, but the candidate will not be able to begin work until the clearance process is complete (generally 4-5 weeks).
Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. VSE considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Power System Dispatcher (Technical Writer/Outage Coordinator)
job description:
Duties
Summary
Where would I be working?
Western Area Power Administration, Rocky Mountain Region, Power System Operations, Reliability Operations, Phoenix, AZ J4900.

Find out more about living conditions at this duty station.

Responsibilities
The Reliability/Balancing Technical Writer is responsible for developing, reviewing, and updating system drawings, diagrams, standard operating procedures, and other operating instructional and statistical documents related to the Reliability/Balancing function of the Rocky Mountain Region's Western Area Colorado Missouri (WACM) and Western Area Lower Colorado (WALC) Balancing Authorities. The incumbent develops and maintains documentation for demonstrating power system dispatch compliance with North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) Standards for WACM and WALC. The incumbent works closely with the WACM and WALC Reliability /Balancing Supervisors and Technical Writers to provide necessary support for the on-shift Power System Dispatcher tools, including accounting and scheduling tools, Reserve Group tools, policy and procedure tools, as well as specific tools created in Excel, PI, etc. necessary to perform the Reliability/Balancing function. The incumbent will work to maintain similar tools and procedures for the WACM and WALC Balancing Authorities. The incumbent may be required to coordinate with and support the WACM and WALC Transmission Scheduling and Security function where common needs are present. The incumbent is responsible for the operation of the WACM and WALC Balancing Authorities and meeting applicable DOE, Western Area Power Administration (Western),Western Electricity Coordinating Council (WECC) and (NERC) operating Criteria, Standards, and Procedures.
Travel Required
25% or less - Overnight travel of 5 or more nights is required.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
05
Job family (Series)
0303 Miscellaneous Clerk And Assistant
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Males must abide by Selective Service registration requirements.
N/A
Qualifications
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position is defined as: This experience is progressively responsible and concerned primarily with system operations of a large power system (100-kV or above).

Specialized Experience Requirements for the AD-5 Level

To qualify for AD-5 level, you must have 1 year of: 1)Power system operator experience, equivalent to the AD-4 level (journey), with centralized SCADA/EMS control and decision-making responsibilities to maintain adherence to NERC reliability standards of a power system with 100-kV or higher voltage transmission lines, substations, and interconnections to other utilities; or 2) Engineering experience (with engineering degree, or certification as either EI, (Engineering Intern), EIT (Engineer in Training), or PE (Professional Engineer), equivalent to the GS-12 level or higher in power system design, planning, maintenance, construction, SCADA, EMS, or operations, or 3) Instructor/teaching experience equivalent to the GS-12 level or higher in power system design, planning, maintenance, construction, SCADA, EMS, or operations. Use of NERC’s Systematic Approach to Training (SAT), or other equivalent training models, is preferable.

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience contained in your resume and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position. DO NOT write "see resume" in your application!
Knowledge of interconnected power systems
Knowledge of safe switching procedures
Knowledge of power system Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition-type equipment (SCADA), Automatic Generation Control (AGC), Energy Management System (EMS), power scheduling programs, power system tagging programs, Open Access Same-time Information System (OASIS)
Knowledge of power system generation (power plant operator) and characteristics
Knowledge of power system equipment; and/or knowledge of balancing authority energy scheduling
"Experience" refers to paid and unpaid experience. Examples of qualifying unpaid experience may include: volunteer work done through National Service programs (such as Peace Corps and AmeriCorps); as well as work for other community-based philanthropic and social organizations. Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills; and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.
Education
For this position, education cannot be substituted for experience.
Additional information
If selection is made at a lower grade, promotion up to the full performance level may be made without further competition. However, promotion(s) will depend on the performance of the incumbent and are not guaranteed.
You must test negative for illegal drugs before placement in the position, and will be subject to random drug testing thereafter. If a determination of the use of illegal drugs is confirmed, non-selection or disciplinary action, up to and including removal from Federal service, may result.
This position requires completion of an annual medical examination at Federal expense. Failure to pass subsequent tests could result in disciplinary action, up to and including removal from the Federal service.
The employee is expected to be in an on-call status on a rotational basis. While in an on-call status, the employee is required to carry an electronic paging device and will remain within one-half hour travel time of their primary place of residence and will sustain themselves in an able- to- respond- and- perform- work condition.
You must become certified as a power system operator by the North American Reliability Council (NERC) within the first 11 months after appointment, and maintain appropriate certification during your employment. This is a condition of employment.
If you are tentatively selected for this position, you will be required to have a physical examination that will determine whether you are qualified to perform the duties of the position. An offer of employment will depend upon your successfully passing the physical examination. You would be assigned rotating shifts, since the power system operates 24 hours a day. Your workweek may include weekends and holidays
If selected for this position, your appointment is contingent upon completion of OF-306, Declaration for Federal Employment, during the pre-employment process. If selected, you will be required to complete a questionnaire and are subject to a criminal background check to determine suitability for Federal employment before appointment.
If you believe that you are eligible for the Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP), please visit the OPM ICTAP/CTAP website for more information. In order to be considered under the ICTAP program, your application must score within the pre-established "well qualified" category as stated in the Qualifications section.
More than one selection may be made from this vacancy announcement.
Some positions may require completion of a probationary period of up to 1 (one) year.
All males born after December 31, 1959 must abide by laws regarding Selective Service registration. To learn more about this law, visit the Selective Service web page, Who Must Register. If you are not registered and don't have an approved exemption, you will not be eligible for employment with the Federal government.
The selectee for this position may be eligible to receive a recruitment or relocation incentive. You will need to sign an employment agreement to be eligible for this incentive.
Veterans Information: https://help.usajobs.gov/index.php/Veterans_Information
Selective Service Registration: http://www.sss.gov/

The U.S. Department of Energy fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
The Department of Energy uses an application tracking system to evaluate the responses you provide in the applicant assessment questionnaire to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications necessary for this position. Then, the HR Office and/or Subject Matter Expert (SME) will conduct a quality review of your application and supporting documentation to determine if your qualifications meet the criteria for referral to the selecting official.

We will also verify that you are eligible for Merit Promotion positions by reviewing your previous Federal employment. If you are eligible to apply to Merit Promotion announcements based on Veteran or other non-competitive statuses, we will verify your supporting documentation prior to referral.

If you are eligible for career transition assistance plans such as ICTAP or CTAP, you must meet the definition of "well qualified" which is defined as having a score of 85 or better.

If your resume is incomplete or does not support the responses you provided in your online questionnaire, or if you fail to submit all required documentation before the vacancy closes, you may be rated 'ineligible', 'not qualified', or your score may be adjusted accordingly.
